reviewText:
Where is Piper, Bret Hart, Big Boss Man, Dibease, Hacksaw, Scott Hall, Steiners, and oh I can go on. You know the guys that are interesting. The new guys looks stupid, and well. I guess they could say Hulk Hogan looks stupid then and now. I retract that statement. Though I think it is hard to deny the appeal of the older guys. Also you have to play rock paper scissors type of thing for starting control of a match, and QTEs here and there. What is that about. However, this is accually a very good wrestling game and fun.
So the graphics and performance are fine. I had one crash on the performance side; while trying to replay a match it had a glitch, That was at around an hour in and have not had another. I also got some very rare pause. It resumes fine, but it is not welcome.The graphics are pretty good here and you will need a decent GPU to run this correctly. Something the power of the Xbox One really to get a good looking game. So 660gtx or 7770 or so. That being said this is a really good looking game at times, though some wrestlers look strange. Like DDP, Andrea, and Savage. Others look great; like Hogan, Flair, and all of the newer guys. The crowd is all rendered decently and packed if you can run it. The animations mostly look awesome. As for the port qulity. Well... You have less options here than anything else in the game. You have resolution/frame rate, FXAA, MSAA, Crowd size, and that about it. So make sure you have a decent GPU. That being said it does not really stress my GPU that much. This is just a beefed up port and that is all you can expect.
Sound is another stronge point with some let down. The announcers really do not say enough different things. On the otherside the intros are pretty good as well as the sound effects. Character Creater lets you choose what the announcer calls your fella. This could and should be better. The announcer should have clips of sounding out letters that we put together. Instead I am stuck with Bill Gold Burglur or Goldman, Scott Mall, Scott Spider, and Ted D B Ox. Eh... Close enough. Rather than getting each letter sounded out and making it ourselves. Entrance music leaves a lot to be desired as well. Custome characters do not have much original stuff to pick from.
Characters wise I do feel they should have had more. Mrs. Elizbeth, Hart, and Piper really should be here. The newer guys are all fine, and a big bonus is the WCW pack included. Though Goldberg should have been in there. What we do get is mostly great, except for the '11 Orton and Orton 04 and Orton 13 and... That is a constume change disgused as a different character and to many do it. If they wanted to make a difference what about the guys that had changed a lot over their careers. Andrea was taller and 150 pounds lighter in his early years. So Andea 77 would make for a far better game then Shamus from 3 weeks ago. Though the Undertaker from 91 is in here so that is cool. That being said there is enough to find a favorite.
Gameplay wise this is a mixed bag. The reversal system is a pain. It is do able, but not absolute. You can turn it off as well as most anythnig else. The reversal I turned off for the CPU but I can still do it. That gets me to the mechanics. A man down tends to stay down. Seriously be aggressive, because it is a pain to get back in control. The other issue is my biggest problem with the game. Pin fall. Being pinned is the most annoying, idiotic method I could immagine. Hold a button and release on a mark. So first time mark is big, then it gets smaller. No matter how stronge your character is or weak the cpu is. Submission you tap a button. This makes more sense. Everything else though is good. Moves are easy to pull off but a little complicated to finding out which one you want. Physics are good and the hits are hard. There is an amazing wrestling game in here. There really is. But, you may not want to learn it. This is best played with a controller and every single button is used. I'm talking D pad and Right stick are all used and nessesary. Once I got a feel for it I was happy with it.
So should you buy this? Depends on what you are expecting I guess. This is the first wrestling game I bought since No Mercy and my first on PC since WCW Thunder(it took nearly 20 years to get over it). I am really enjoying myself with 2k15. The Caw wrestler list is decent, but I have to make the old old guys like Ernie The Big Cat Ladd and Bruno. Though it  is easy enough. Personally this is a buy for $12.50 and given that Hogan will not appear in 2k16(if it comes to PC) it could be worth it for more. Not $50-60, but $30 all day. To me $12 is a great deal and a buy for any current or former wrestling fan. It is stupid fun as pro wrestling is, but that is still fun. Sometimes the best kind of fun.

reviewText: The game gets a bad rap, but that doesnt mean you shouldnt still give it a go. Is this as easy to get into as the Smackdown games or WWF No Mercy? No. The control system takes a while to master, and reversals are bloody hit and miss. It takes realism (yes, realism in pro wrestling) perhaps a bit too far, and your wrestler not reversing every move an oponent throws at you is one of those concequences. Even with the learning curve, Im still recommending this, why? The career mode is pretty damn enjoyable.\n\nCreate your star and rise up from NXT all the way through to RAW, with a branching story line which I honestly enjoyed playing. Perhaps not something to get at full price (I didnt), but I got 18 hours out of the story mode and that was time well spent (apart from being F5d through a table....that was not time well spent)

reviewText: It has been quite a few years since I've owned a console, and one of the few games that I used to play that hasn't come to the PC is WWE. However, now the series has finally returned and honestly, after the nostalgia wears off it is just decent. I mean, while MyCareer is certainly entertaining, it has its limitations and being that I've been living off MDickie games for the past few years, and have seen promos for 5 Star Wrestling, honestly I'm left feeling like the same issues that existed back when PS2 was current gen still exist.\n\nThere is seemingly only a strong focus on making everyone look realistic, and the game just good enough so that the majority of the complaints can only be personal. However, as many already know, this year's game is stripped to the minimum due to 2K trying to make this their game and no longer just something they bought off of THQ. Unfortunately though, whether you prefer to play as wrestlers or sim everything, you won't find this game to be long awaited and well deserved. At the same time though, it does feel better than nothing and perhaps could just be a taste of what is to come.

reviewText:
First one on PC in over a decade - Well worth the wait for PC gamers. I'd highly recommend it to all the WWE / Wrestling fans.

As usual, just like any other game, WWE 2K15 has its own pros and cons.

(+) Gameplay: I don't understand the logic behind negative reviews regarding the gameplay, it's by no means slow. It's hands down by far the best in the series so far, keeping realism and joy in mind, this couldn't have been any better. Animations starts to change as you progress in a match and it looks spectacular, it does not affect the gameplay in any negative way, it makes it more enjoyable and heart racing. It is exactly as it should be.

(+) Graphics: There's nothing much to say about that, It didn't lag behind. it is as it should be given the current gen graphics.

(-) Online: The only negative thing about this game is online, if you're looking to buy it only to play online then I wouldn't recommend it. Frequent disconnection and terrible matchmaking is really a pain in this game not to mention that kicking out of pin in online matches is literally impossible.

(+-) Commentary: Commentarty has improved a lot compared to the previous installments of the 2k series but it still tends to get annoying at times due to repetition of same old phrases and of course some of the phrases from the previous games are also there which tends to be sickening if you've played the previous installments a lot..

There's lack of match types and stuff in this game but it's not that big of a problem.

The 2K Showcase mode offers hours of fun and the career mode itself despite being very bland, it's still kinda fun for some reason, I played it 20+ hours and it was mostly the same throughout. There were very few cutscenes and dialogues. Starting in 2015 and ending your career in virtual 2030, you'll keep getting same messages from Vicky Guerrero for all those 15 virtual years.

All in all, despite the lack of modes and bland career mode with terrible online, WWE 2k15 is still packed with lots of fun and is worth buying. The gameplay has never been more fun and playing multiplayer on one screen is of course the best thing about WWE 2k15. It's endless fun given the big roster.

+ Gameplay (10/10)
+ Graphics / Animations
+ 2K Showcase Mode
+ Big roster
+ Career mode
-  Lack of match types
-  Terrible online

*9/10* (Awesome)

If you like Wrestling-games and if you're into the WWE, you should get this one. It's easily one of the greatest WWE-games ever. >.o

reviewText:
good:
-first WWE game on PC
-graphics are nice
-the DLC expands the roster to a decent level, though theres some glaring holes I wish they would have filled
-the career mode makes you focus on putting on good matches (with variety, cool spots, back and forth, etc) instead of just winning. this is a pretty clever way of getting around the fact that the ai will not be able to really challenge you once your guy is rated 95+
-the showcases are well done
-universe mode can be interesting if you put some effort into it and have patience (see bad)
-the entrance creator (excepting music/video) is pretty versatile and you can make something neat out of it

bad:
-a lot of the menus are very tedious to deal with
-there's not much in the way of tutorial
-the career mode can drag in parts, particularly in between NXT and Smackdown
-not nearly enough women in the game, no capability for custom women, and Paige exclusive to consoles
-universe mode can get very tedious particularly with the longer rivalries (same exact and trying to change around rivalry matches can end the rivalry early by accident.
-there's no custom videos or music for entrances (though you can use an outside utility that you can find on the wwe 2k15 forums to replace the existing ones with your own music or video files, though this isn't really the easiest to thing to do)
-there's a total lack of generic videos for entrances and nearly every one has some kind of name on it that makes it unsuitable for a custom wrestler
-there's a pretty poor selection of entrances for two-man teams and literally just two for three-man teams
-lots of stuff that was in wwe 2k14 was taken out for 2k15, hopefully it'll be back next year

overall, i'm not disappointed with the purchase and feel like it was worth the full purchase price

reviewText: So these are the things I like and don't like about this game. First, the graphics are nice some lag during certain entrances but other then that it is fine. Some glitches like the replays don't work or the ropes are not visible but I haven't come across anything that has majorly impacted my gaming experience yet. The 2k story mode is challenging and can get frustrating at times to complete the objective for the bonus. (Also please keep in mind you can go back and try to complete those objectives when you finish) Universe mode is basically the same as it always has been but with story clues that you can unlock by playing matches or certain rivalry matches. The regular exhibition does not have a big match variety as in previous games. Only 2 types of 2v2 tag matches Normal and Elimination. There is no inferno match which was disappointing. The reversal system can be frustrating as well because it works like this when the reversal button appears on the screen it will say you were too early too late or reverse it. I personally have gotten too early or too late when I felt like I didn't but that's just me. Career mode is fun you start from NXT and work your way up. The one thing I don't like about it is the stamina system and here is an example. (I was in a steel cage match vs Randy Orton I hit my finisher but since it used all my stamina I fell down and could not get up and Randy Orton got up before me even though I just hit him with my finisher. I am still down spamming the get up button as Randy proceeds to climb the cage I finally get up but fall to one knee. I am still spamming the get up button and Randy is still climbing the cage. He climbs over the top and wins the match and I am still on one knee and this is all after Randy just took a finisher from me. I hope this review helps. I would gives this game an overall rating of 8/10.

reviewText:
MysterD's Opinion:
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Full Review is in My Group:
For my full thoughts + full review, which is too long for this Steam Review section - just look at these threads in particular from My Group.

My Early Impressions:
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/TGAEC/discussions/0/517141882710993512/

My Review, Part 1: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/TGAEC/discussions/0/451848855027872605/

My Review, Part 2: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/TGAEC/discussions/0/451848855027877070/

This Steam Mini-Review Page:
http://steamcommunity.com/id/mysterd/recommended/240460

Mini-Review:
If (and likely when) WWE 2K16 hits the PC, that should improve & add more of the kitchen sink (more match types, ability to do run-in's, Create-A-Diva, more wrestlers, etc) that seem to be missing from 2K15 by default that others have had complaints about for features that were missing from previous WWE wrestling games.

And if you have some kind of complaint with 2K15 - go check the modding scene & find some mods, as many of those complaints have been already fixed by modders themselves, if you're willing to mod the game up.

Even despite my list of complaints, it just gets so many things right & there's already so much content here - that it's very hard to ignore this, even despite its faults. Even more so true, especially if you're a fan of WWE, wrestling games, & fighting games - this game should be right up your alley; it's just a really good wrestling game, IMHO.

2K15 here has a great foundation now set for future wrestling games - and especially if bought on sale (which has been around $13 on Steam and elsewhere), you're likely going to get your money's worth here somewhere. Whether it's MyCareer, MyUniverse, or 2K Showcase - there's going to be at least be something here for someone who likes these types of wrestling games; especially even more so true, if you're a WWE fan.

After at least 95 hours (or so), I always seem to find more time for a few hours worth of gameplay (especially in MyUniverse Mode) or at least just squeeze in one more match - so, that has to be speak for a lot here; as I always seem to find some time to play this very good wrestling game.

reviewText:
Played this game for 16 hours. At least six of those hours were spent updating the roster and downloading CAWs in order to try and make this game at least somewhat up-to-date.

Spent over an hour creating a CAW of myself. The body features are the absolute most primitive that they've been since the PS2 era and I found that I could only facially make a guy that somewhat resembled me and actually looks like every other CAW out there. Clothing system was good in terms of detail, but extremely poor in terms of not being able to mirror knee/elbowpads and make the character's attire symmetrical. What should have taken me no more than 20 minutes took over an hour thanks to poor optimisation and awful loading times.

No game should require the amount of set-up and 'housekeeping' that this one does. You insist on making a WWE sports game, yet you refuse to give it the kind of updates and authenticity in terms of how up-to-date the roster is as well as not providing nearly enough tools to create missing characters for ourselves. If you're not going to have Zach Ryder in the game, but you're willing to keep his moveset in there as a template, is it really too much to ask to have access to his music and tron as well, considering they are available in your library?! Edge and Christian were absent from this one, again, there's moves and move templates, but no music...no tron...no tools!!

Speaking of tools, the actual meat and gravy of the game itself is still riddled and infested with bugs, including a really awesome ( :/ ) one that my CAW encountered while defending his NXT title in the extremely sparse, non-voiced MyCareer mode. I selected 'Spear 1' as his finish, only to find that not once, but twice did my character fail to lock on to the enemy character, miss the attack and actually take damage, drop to a knee and allow the opponent to take over the flow of the match. This is game breaking and unacceptable of a full priced title in 2015. I've read that this was a known issue months ago, so the fact that this game has become abandonware in such a short space of time is absolutely astonishing to me.

Even on low settings with V-Sync turned off, performance is extremely shoddy and controller input frequently lags behind the action, which in a game where you are utterly, crippilingly reliant on reversing everything, completely breaks the gameplay experience.

This game was released in April and was never fixed. I've paid my hard earned money for this game and it was never fixed.

I genuinely used to love WWE games and was extremely excited for this one finally releasing on PC...I thought of the many awesome and incredible things that the modding community could do with it, custom titantrons, custom music, community roster updates...all of these things were blocked by 2K because this is a direct port of the console version of the game, warts and all. Not only are the creation tools provided substandard, but the game doesn't...even...work

2K, I really, honestly and genuinely wish that I didn't have to write this. When you aquired this license from THQ, I celebrated that aquisition because I believed you'd do what needed to be done and overhaul the ageing technology and deliver the ultimate WWE sports game. I'm sad that I've been proven wrong about you and that I have to tell you today how absolutely horrible my experience with this game has been.

I'm sorry to say that as it stands, I'm not only finished with your WWE games but also with 2K games as a whole, because quite frankly, when I pay my hard earned money for an entertainment product and it does the exact opposite of what it's supposed to do, then you're doing it wrong for making it and I'm doing it wrong for buying it and putting up with it.

My biggest suggestion in closing would be to take a year out and figure out how to improve the game, rather than releasing seasonal updates that are out-of-date, not fun to play and unpolished/finished.

Good Luck.

3 / 10

EDIT: I understand based on reading and video that WWE2K16 is a similar story, in that it has a huge roster that is mostly out-of-date, has failed to include the HUGELY important Four Horsewomen and again has a slew of bugs affecting gameplay. Again, I can't recommend enough skipping 2K17 and focusing on what you need to to bring this up to scratch.

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game. I have played a number of other games in the series and have enjoyed them. I can't recommend it based on one primary factor: the story mode is terrible.

Conceptually, it makes a ton of sense. You start off weak and at the Performance Center. This should be a cool experience. However, the combination of not being able to change the difficulty, forcing a minigame into the matches (chain wrestling), and an AI system that makes no sense have turned me off from the game.

Specifically, I'm a new superstar fighting other rookies. They counter my specials, and kick out of my finisher after I've been beating on them forever. I hit the guy with a big move, and he's up before I am and taking over, even though my health and spirit are above his. It's frustrating.

And yes, this is because I am not good at countering. I've been good at it in previous games. I don't know if the window is smaller or what, but I find it incredibly frustrating that a) I can't win matches because I'm not good enough, and b) I can't change the difficulty despite this being available in every other game mode.

Super disappointing.

reviewText:
=+= A WWE game on PC, that is something i never expected
=+= The game looks pretty.
=+= Animations are great.
=+= It's on PC.
=+= Brock Lesnar is still scary
=+= 2k Showcase is interesting, but not as good as 30 Years of wrestlemania.
=+= Keyboard controls are manageable, but it's hard to move and do reversals, or drag your opponents.

=-= Customization options are very limited.
=-= Game is pretty outdated (Released sometime in october 2014)
=-= Artificial Intelligence is not very Intelligent
=-= Commentary feels repetitive at time
=-= Non-Linear career feels linear, albeit pretty fun
=-= Many contents removed from previous titles (Creating arenas, Titantron video etc.)
=-= No updates or changes from previous release on Xbox One and PS4
=-= Limited spots for created wrestlers
=-= No way to Import your own music or titantron videos
=-= John Cena is still highest ranked Superstar
=-= You can't create Divas

Conclusion
The gameplay mechanic is very different compared to previous titles, you can only go to a front facelock and four front standing grapple and four rear sanding grapple instead of a front facelock, side headlock, wristlock, and waistlock which would transition into 6 different moves each. This means less locking-up and more in your face fast pace action and less move to be assigned during character creation.  Chain wrestling is cool, but slows down the gameplay.
If you have played the old WWE games you would feel a very lackluster amount of customization options. If you have played the game on the next gen consoles, then you are basically getting the exact same game, and if you are expecting a smoother experience because it's running on a PC then i am afraid i have got some bad news. The port isn't too great. I'm getting massive amounts of Lag on my Asus G550 that can run most games on High without many problems. The DLC just arrived, so that'll probably add some hours of gameplay.
SO
If you want the game for the sake of gameplay and fighting mechanics, then grab this game.
If you want the game for the downright crazy levels of customization in WWE game and the ability to shape the world of the WWE universe in your vision then you probably want to get an earlier title HOWEVER i would still recommend this game to anyone who is a a wrestlng fan because at the very least it still offers fun gameplay

reviewText: Good WWE game. Would not get for 50 bucks maybe 20-30. It's the first wwe game on pc and is pretty good for their first pc port. reviewText:
You think this game sucks? Guess what? IT DOESN'T MATTER WHAT YOU THINK!

Always loved the WWE games, even the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ones like SmackDown vs. RAW 2008 and SmackDown vs. RAW 2009, and this one is no exception. Must've had a few hundred hours on the PS4 version, and since this is the first time a WWE game has been released on PC, I couldn't help but purchase it.

Of course the game has its flaws such as less match types compared to the previous game, and a pretty low amount of CAW spaces, but since 2K have confirmed that people will be able to mod the game, it'll be really interesting to see what they come up with.

Would recommend this to any wrestling fan out there, and even if you're not a avid WWE fan, it's still a very enjoyable game to play. So what are you waiting for? IT'S TIME TO PLAY THE GAME!

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game. I have played a number of other games in the series and have enjoyed them. I can't recommend it based on one primary factor: the story mode is terrible.

Conceptually, it makes a ton of sense. You start off weak and at the Performance Center. This should be a cool experience. However, the combination of not being able to change the difficulty, forcing a minigame into the matches (chain wrestling), and an AI system that makes no sense have turned me off from the game.

Specifically, I'm a new superstar fighting other rookies. They counter my specials, and kick out of my finisher after I've been beating on them forever. I hit the guy with a big move, and he's up before I am and taking over, even though my health and spirit are above his. It's frustrating.

And yes, this is because I am not good at countering. I've been good at it in previous games. I don't know if the window is smaller or what, but I find it incredibly frustrating that a) I can't win matches because I'm not good enough, and b) I can't change the difficulty despite this being available in every other game mode.

Super disappointing.

reviewText:
As far as actual wrestling goes its very good, all those moves, hitboxes being fine, wrestlers and the feel of it, its wonderfull. The actual gameplay is 9/10, with you being rewarded for doing different stuff and having fun instead of mashing same few moves.

What is wrong is bad tutorial which led to about 2  hours of sadness and getting rekt, before i could figure out how some things worked. But after it? Fun unbound! Balanced 'ladder' curve, amazing 2v2 matches (single most fun mode for me, lobbing stairs at ring while running around and being an assohle without being disqualified was amazing run in smack a dude run off.)

What also is lacking is interactions with people outside of the ring, press conferences, photoshoots with fans, hanging out with other pros and having a good time, that kinda thing. It doesnt need to be mandatory, just for those who are willing. Because for me it would mean a better immersion = higher game quality.
Some music playing during the actual fights would be great, aswell as effects like fire, fireworks, smoke or whatever just as cosmetical stuff to spice things up and accentiate some of the more solid smacks : )

Maybe its my current 38 C  body temperature speaking, but i had a lot of fun in this game. Its simply good entertainment without anyone getting hurt. Nothing to not like!

reviewText:
It's real nice to see a WWE game come to PC. It's been many years, and is definitely a welcome addition.

That being said, the entire game feels like a demo. The pacing of the wrestling is extremely slow, the mini-games seem pointless and go on entirely too long, and the creations are not as in depth as previous games. From what I understand a lot of this comes from the switchover from THQ to 2K. It seems fairly obvious, as there's not as much polish and overall sticking to 2014 would probably be the best choice, even though they don't have it on PC.

Hopefully 2k16 is a fuller game. But for now if you're looking for an exciting experience, look elsewhere.

reviewText:
I wanted to get back into wrestling games since the last one I played was wwe 2k12 So I thought I'd give this one a shot while it was on sale...
But like Eva Marie, this game doesn't work.
-Gameplay was extremely sluggish. I would press buttons to make my character do things and he would stand there contemplating how to do said move (YOU SHOULDN'T LAG OFFLINE).
-Online mode (which I looked forward to more than anything) is badly designed. To be fair I was still trying to learn the game, but it appears that in order to set up an online match, you must SET UP A MATCH. By which I mean, not only the style, rules, arena and such...but even which superstars will be wrestling in said match. My first online match was John Cena (me) vs The Rock (opponent)...I never picked John Cena...the game just made me play John Cena. Nothing against John Cena but, this has to be the lamest online mode ever.
You've probably read enough about creation sucking...but here's one more.
-Creation sucks. I was bummed to see there was no more finisher creation. But I got over it...until I got to move selection for my lucha" loadout...all my moves were almost as basic as Los Matadores. I couldn't seem to find a top rope finisher tab. So no crazy splash for my "thirst for high impact" (RIP Flyin' Brian Pillman) Luchadore. But did you know what I could use as a finisher? A stomp
date: a kerhuffin' stomp!!! Not a Seth Rollins style curb stomp
recommended: but a basic chest stomp you use while the other wrestler recovers to keep the action going

reviewText:
Graphics are great!  Actions are great!  No real story line, but it's wrestleing and there hasn't been a good enough story line since Stone Cold vs. McMahon (Guess I gotta wait for 2k16).

Now if they could just stop it from crashing every 20 mins.

If they ever fix the XAudio2_7.dll file so that I don't have to change it every time to a .bak file.  I'll change my review as that is the only problem I've been having with the game.

The file in question is
C:\windows\system32\XAudio2_7.dll

change it to a .bak file restart your system and delete the new XAudio2_7.dll file if it creates it the game works great since.

reviewText: Good WWE game. Would not get for 50 bucks maybe 20-30. It's the first wwe game on pc and is pretty good for their first pc port. Though there are some flaws with the game in general not the port. First off when compared to the previous titles such as WWE '13 and Smackdown VS Raw 2011, customization is severly limited. No longer can you create odd abstract characters (Hulk, Spongebob etc.). But it's not just the body customization that has been limited it's everything. The clothing is very VERY limited. Only 2 frontal baseball caps? There's about 10 haircuts to choose from compared to the 30-40 in previous games it's terrible. But it's 2K's second wwe game. No onto the game itself. It seems everyone's going on about how terrible controls are.  Personally I find them to be okay for a pc wrestling game. I would not call it unplayable but a controller would be a nice addition. Though it is a bit slower-paced when compared to the last games made before 2K took over you gotta understand 2k's used to makign realistic sports games so no wonder it will become more realistic in terms of gameplay. The roster is a bit smaller than usual but it does feature some epic legends like hogan,sting,the ultimate warrior etc.If you're a die-hard WWE fan I would get it if not then wait for the sale

reviewText:
As a huge wrestling fan all my life, the second i heard that wwe 2k15 was coming to steam i went straight to the steam store and bought it, it includes all of the game's DLC except for Paige and it was a cheaper price then the console versions, so i was very happy about it.

For starters the game itself is very well optimized, I had no crashes or weird bugs and was able to run the game with all graphic settings maxed out at 1080p at a constant 60FPS! except for entrances which are locked at 30FPS, the gameplay is very smooth and fluid and the controls of the game were actually really easy for me to learn and actually work quite well, however the game dosent use your mouse just keyboard.The game had a few good modes like 2K Showcase which i really enjoyed and WWE Universe mode can be fun too but it can get very repetitive.

As for the negative sides of the game there are a few of them, firstly the game's career mode is very bad and boring with plenty of repetition and no story actually being told, Vickie just keeps telling you that she has nothing for you this week and once you win the WWE Championship your career ends by saying your superstar fought legends over the years and had great matches, secondly the online part of the game is absolutely terrible, the matchmaking system is one of the worst i have seen being implemented in a video game,you can be waiting ages to get a match and then when you find a opponent to wrestle against you have to wait for their response and you dont even know who it is, lastly although it may be a minor thing to some people but to me it's major, the game's soundtrack is the worst i have ever heard, it has I say 3 songs that i actually like and there is only 10 of the songs repeating over and over again, you cant even inport your own music for the soundtrack, also when i said lastly i realized i had forgot a very inportant issue in this game, the lack of creation options is mindblowing, there is no create a diva, no create an arena, no create a title, no create a finisher, and the list just goes on and on and on.

Overall if you are a huge wrestling fan then i would suggested it to you as there is some fun to be had and its WWE on PC so yes there is mods for superstars if you know where to get them, but if you want to play this because its a sports games, well then you might be disappointed, I am hopeful however that we will get WWE 2K16 on PC next year and it sounds like there has been massive inprovements!

reviewText:
=+= A WWE game on PC, that is something i never expected
=+= The game looks pretty.
=+= Animations are great.
=+= It's on PC.
=+= Brock Lesnar is still scary
=+= 2k Showcase is interesting, but not as good as 30 Years of wrestlemania.
=+= Keyboard controls are manageable, but it's hard to move and do reversals, or drag your opponents.

=-= Customization options are very limited.
=-= Game is pretty outdated (Released sometime in october 2014)
=-= Artificial Intelligence is not very Intelligent
=-= Commentary feels repetitive at time
=-= Non-Linear career feels linear, albeit pretty fun
=-= Many contents removed from previous titles (Creating arenas, Titantron video etc.)
=-= No updates or changes from previous release on Xbox One and PS4
=-= Limited spots for created wrestlers
=-= No way to Import your own music or titantron videos
=-= John Cena is still highest ranked Superstar
=-= You can't create Divas

Conclusion
The gameplay mechanic is very different compared to previous titles, you can only go to a front facelock and four front standing grapple and four rear sanding grapple instead of a front facelock, side headlock, wristlock, and waistlock which would transition into 6 different moves each. This means less locking-up and more in your face fast pace action and less move to be assigned during character creation.  Chain wrestling is cool, but slows down the gameplay.
If you have played the old WWE games you would feel a very lackluster amount of customization options. If you have played the game on the next gen consoles, then you are basically getting the exact same game, and if you are expecting a smoother experience because it's running on a PC then i am afraid i have got some bad news. The port isn't too great. I'm getting massive amounts of Lag on my Asus G550 that can run most games on High without many problems. The DLC just arrived, so that'll probably add some hours of gameplay.
SO
If you want the game for the sake of gameplay and fighting mechanics, then grab this game.
If you want the game for the downright crazy levels of customization in WWE game and the ability to shape the world of the WWE universe in your vision then you probably want to get an earlier title HOWEVER i would still recommend this game to anyone who is a a wrestlng fan because at the very least it still offers fun gameplay

reviewText: Good WWE game. Would not get for 50 bucks maybe 20-30. It's the first wwe game on pc and is pretty good for their first pc port. Though there are some flaws with the game in general not the port. First off when compared to the previous titles such as WWE '13 and Smackdown VS Raw 2011, customization is severly limited. No longer can you create odd abstract characters (Hulk, Spongebob etc.). But it's not just the body customization that has been limited it's everything. The clothing is very VERY limited. Only 2 frontal baseball caps? There's about 10 haircuts to choose from compared to the 30-40 in previous games it's terrible. But it's 2K's second wwe game. No onto the game itself. It seems everyone's going on about how terrible controls are.  Personally I find them to be okay for a pc wrestling game. I would not call it unplayable but a controller would be a nice addition. Though it is a bit slower-paced when compared to the last games made before 2K took over you gotta understand 2k's used to makign realistic sports games so no wonder it will become more realistic in terms of gameplay. The roster is a bit smaller than usual but it does feature some epic legends like hogan,sting,the ultimate warrior etc.If you're a die-hard WWE fan I would get it if not then wait for the sale

reviewText:
Graphics are great!  Actions are great!  No real story line, but it's wrestleing and there hasn't been a good enough story line since Stone Cold vs. McMahon (Guess I gotta wait for 2k16).

Now if they could just stop it from crashing every 20 mins.

If they ever fix the XAudio2_7.dll file so that I don't have to change it every time to a .bak file.  I'll change my review as that is the only problem I've been having with the game.

The file in question is
C:\windows\system32\XAudio2_7.dll

change it to a .bak file restart your system and delete the new XAudio2_7.dll file if it creates it the game works great since.

reviewText:
Please for the love of God do NOT buy this horrible game.

QUICK VIEW:

-NO STEAM CONTROLLER SUPPORT. Oh my word. I can't even.
-Overall controls make no sense whatsoever.
-Bizarre limitations in character creation (which should be a cornerstone for a PC game)
-D+ overall grade

Welcome to PC, WWE. You earn no points and may God have mercy on your soul.

I am a die-hard, long-time WWE/WWF/professional wrestling fan. I am also an avid but admittedly casual gamer. My favorite wrestling games are still the AKI-produced games of the late 1990s/early 2000s, especially Wrestlemania 2000 and WWF No Mercy. Simple, clean combat systems, easy-to-comprehend controls, fun for all.

WWE 2K16 is a nightmare of quirky and nonsenical controls combined with a horrible PC port. First of all, how can a PC game have NO SUPPORT FOR STEAM CONTROLLER WHATSOEVER? The game recognizes the Steam Controller only as a keyboard input. I can't learn how to play your game when you are demanding I press Q" on a contoller with no Q button.

The match mechanics are nonsensical. Kicking out of a pinfall--ANY pinfall--is modeled after the old Madden field goal system: you have to stop a moving target. It's just stupid. No wrestling game should ever put you at peril of a pinfall after the first danged move.

There are positives but I am scared that if I list them you will actually buy this terrible
voteText: step up your game or nobody is buying this trash on PC except on a 99 cent mega-sale."

reviewText:
I'll start by saying this, I'm a very big fan of the WWE/WWF video games and of the Attitude Era, so I was very excited when I learned that finally a WWE game would hit the PC platform. As most of us, PC folk, I've spent countless hours fiddling around with emulators, and was very disappointed when back in 2010 WWE SmackDown vs Raw Online was cancelled. All this, however, changed in April of this year, when our prayers were heared and we received WWE 2K15 !

So, what did we receive ? We received a port of the PS4 version from last year, along with all the bugs, some of which were gamebreakers, and the awful FPS issue. It is worth mentioning that most of them were fixed by the devs and that they provided us with all the DLCs for free, which makes up for the initial problems, in my opinion.

Graphically the game shines ! All the wrestlers are very detailed down to the veins in their ears, almost everything has been redone. The engine has been improved and this year we've gotten a more realistic approach. Previous games were more arcady and the sudden change may not appeal to all!

Gameplay has been significantly slowed down, it isn't as fast-paced as before. Throughout the match you can feel how the wrestlers lose their strength. Each punch brings them closer to the ground, many times your wrestler will collapse right after performing his finisher. Luckily this new stamina feature can be toned down. A new mini game has also been featured. It can be initiated in the first few minutes of the match and consists of a few strategical chain grapples, giving your wrestler an advantage if completed properly. Sadly the new physics system is mostly broken. Weapons refuse to stay in the ring, and the ladders have become mostly useless. Breaking them is almost impossible and no longer are you able to stack them in the corner.

WWE 2K15's roster feels very lacking compared to recent predecessors. Many wrestlers from past years are nowhere to be found, and most of the unlockables are either different attires or different versions of the same wrestler. Even worse is the new create-a-wrestler. Two-third of this feature has been completely stripped off, including the create-a-diva section. Missing are also: create-a-finisher, backstage brawls, other match variations, many weapons(crutch, guitar, trashcan) and environmental/total control grapples.

Storywise WWE 2K15 features a new MyCareer mode, Universe mode and 2K Showcase mode. The 2K Showcase mode is the meat on the bone this year. It acts as a history lesson on the Triple H/Shawn Michaels and CM Punk/John Cena feuds, allowing the player to experience the iconic matches in a new way. The new MyCareer mode, however, is just worth skipping, because it ends up being too dull and unrewarding.

So after all this time criticizing this game, why am I giving it a thumbs up ? Like many of us, I want to see the WWE 2K franchise return to the PC platform. This game is far from perfect, but still managed to provide me with some fun moments. I do recommend that you get it, but first be prepared to have to part with some key features!

Final verdict: 6.5/10 ! :]

PS: I am aware of the new installment WWE 2K16. I think that the developers have done a better job this time, and have really listened to their fans. Even though the same problems with the physics still seem to remain, this year's game is a big improvement. I may review it in the future, if it ever gets released on PC!

reviewText:
I would love to give this game a positive review, I really would. I  am a HUGE fan of wrestling as entertainment and I actually had a lot of fun playing this game with my friend. However there is just sooooo many issues with the game (that will not be fixed) that I have had to give it a negative review.

The game crashes on a regular basis for no reason, after trying to swap around allocated ram to sort the problem out I found no avail. Now I would give the benefit of a doubt to the devs to patch this, however the game is now a year old and with the new wwe game out on consoles I doubt that the devs will return to fix this cash cow. Now that is only the cream of the cake as there is no mouse optimisation! What?! How?! Why is there a game on PC without mouse controls in the menu?! I didnt buy a keyboard and MOUSE to have the mosue sit there as a colourful paperweight! You have to use eathier the arrow keys or the wasd keys to navigate through the menu, which is fustrating as all hell!

I could look past all these issues if the game didnt lack content that has been there since wwe raw vs smackdown on the ps2! Wrestlers, arenas and match types are just blatenly missing, obviously cut out to meet the release date set by WWE. The grahical options are limited at best, with AA only up to 8x and no ultra graphical setting to be found. Also a note TAA does not exist in this game, sorry budget end users. Ofcourse though, they add these wrestlers, arenas and match types back in as DLC! Thanks for costing people money, then demmand that they pay more for the other chunk of content the devs hid behind a pay wall for sad lonely, desperate people like me, who really wanted a wwe game on pc to buy up.

Now for some positives for this mess of a game. There are two single player story modes. the John cena vs CM Punk feud and the Shawn Michaels vs Triple H feud. I am glad to say that bouth of these were really enjoyable. I enjoyed the doccumentary style cutscenes with a narrator hyping the matches, that was awsome. I also enjoyed how accurate the feuds were to real life. Personally I enjoyed the Shawn Michaels vs Triple H feud better......but maybe thats only because Shawn Michaels (AKA. The HeatBreak Kid) is my favourite wrestler of all time. But the John cena vs CM Punk feaud was good as well.....even if CM Punk looks a bit crooked.

Overall the game seems to be an up and down expirience for the player. You want to enjnoy the game because its fun and you are releived to finally be playing a wrestling game, however all the technical issues and issues regarding the games lack of content can not be looked over this time.

4.5/10 Technical Issues Hurt The Gameplay" -Joshua Upham
"Cynical Redubs Since 2013"

reviewText:
Well isn't this a mess.

Can't recommend the game. As much as I'd wanted to, it's impossible to recommend this thing.
The servers are constantly down for days, even though they are only supposed to be down near May 2016, MyCareer is my favourite thing and it is just lazy as hell and has, literally, 0 depth to it, and so on and so on.
God, is this bad. As NXT Champion, I have to defend the title EVERY SINGLE WEEK, and after about 3 defenses there comes a time where all you opponents are suddenly overpowered and it takes AGES to beat them. I get that if you're champion for a while, the game should make it harder for you to remain that way. I don't really think that overpowering your opponent in every way possible, instead of just increasing the reversal rate, for instance, is the way to do it. As soon as you lose the championship, tho, all those opponents are easilly beatable within 4-5 minutes. Ex: 10 minute match against Unbeatable Xavier Woods while champion --- 3 minute match with Beatable Ziggler while not.
Have I mentioned how this is supposed to be as real as the real WWE? Well, I don't remember anyone having to defend the NXT Championship for 7 weeks in a row. Nor do I remember anyone being able to choose wether he wanted to defend the title on the 8th week or not, choosing not to, and being stripped out of the championship.

It's a f***ing mess. So much for the return of wrestling to PC.

Try again.

EDIT: I almost forgot to mention that my farewell match at Wrestlemania, after about 6 years in the company, was against a Random Character that had never been seen or mentioned before in this game. I can't believe I forgot to mention tha- oh wait, it's just so bad you can't keep track.

reviewText:
Originally bought this because it is the first WWE title on PC in 13 years and I wanted to see what mods could bring to the game.
However, The tie-up system/chain wrestling is terrible and is basically rock, paper, scissors. You can disable the tie-up/chain wrestling but even without that pain in the ♥♥♥, the reversal system ruins gameplay. The is a helpful inditcator that shows when to press the reversal button, but the timing is off. So its all guesswork on reversing and I often found myself getting my ♥♥♥ kicked nonstop by the CPU.
I didn't get into career mode,WWE universe, create-a-whatever, or online(heard it sucks and/or is broke), but the 2K Showcase is pretty fun. The character selection is pretty good too in my opinion, Sting, Hogan, Ultimate Warrior, Macho Man.
Big disappointment. Not worth the $ or the time it took to download. For now I'll just wait on Pro Wrestling X.

reviewText:
As far as actual wrestling goes its very good, all those moves, hitboxes being fine, wrestlers and the feel of it, its wonderfull. The actual gameplay is 9/10, with you being rewarded for doing different stuff and having fun instead of mashing same few moves.

What is wrong is bad tutorial which led to about 2  hours of sadness and getting rekt, before i could figure out how some things worked. But after it? Fun unbound! Balanced 'ladder' curve, amazing 2v2 matches (single most fun mode for me, lobbing stairs at ring while running around and being an assohle without being disqualified was amazing run in smack a dude run off.)

What also is lacking is interactions with people outside of the ring, press conferences, photoshoots with fans, hanging out with other pros and having a good time, that kinda thing. It doesnt need to be mandatory, just for those who are willing. Because for me it would mean a better immersion = higher game quality.
Some music playing during the actual fights would be great, aswell as effects like fire, fireworks, smoke or whatever just as cosmetical stuff to spice things up and accentiate some of the more solid smacks : )

Maybe its my current 38 C  body temperature speaking, but i had a lot of fun in this game. Its simply good entertainment without anyone getting hurt. Nothing to not like!

reviewText: WWE 2k15 has amazing mechanics that take fairly long to master but once you get around them they are very comfortable and work great for emulating wrestling matches. reviewText:
I've owned every single wwe game going back to NES I have had to adjust to the ever changing control systems.

With that being said WWE2k15 after adjusting to it has been a great game.

Previous versions of these games left it to be no challenge at all

The Reversal System in this game is very time cruical.
Making it a rage haven.

The graphics are great when on high settings.

Loading times are incredible i didnt find myself waiting at all.

Amount of wrestlers once everything is unlocked is great

The online downloadable characters is also nice.

The bad of this game is lack on previous content it feels like the match type have all been stripped.

The AI sometimes is just awful.

No Diva Creation Options.

The Pin system is extremely Aggravating.

Roman reigns AI is Just plain ridiculous

Overall i am really enjoying this game and would reccommend this to any Fan of the series

reviewText:
As a huge wrestling fan all my life, the second i heard that wwe 2k15 was coming to steam i went straight to the steam store and bought it, it includes all of the game's DLC except for Paige and it was a cheaper price then the console versions, so i was very happy about it.

For starters the game itself is very well optimized, I had no crashes or weird bugs and was able to run the game with all graphic settings maxed out at 1080p at a constant 60FPS! except for entrances which are locked at 30FPS, the gameplay is very smooth and fluid and the controls of the game were actually really easy for me to learn and actually work quite well, however the game dosent use your mouse just keyboard.The game had a few good modes like 2K Showcase which i really enjoyed and WWE Universe mode can be fun too but it can get very repetitive.

As for the negative sides of the game there are a few of them, firstly the game's career mode is very bad and boring with plenty of repetition and no story actually being told, Vickie just keeps telling you that she has nothing for you this week and once you win the WWE Championship your career ends by saying your superstar fought legends over the years and had great matches, secondly the online part of the game is absolutely terrible, the matchmaking system is one of the worst i have seen being implemented in a video game,you can be waiting ages to get a match and then when you find a opponent to wrestle against you have to wait for their response and you dont even know who it is, lastly although it may be a minor thing to some people but to me it's major, the game's soundtrack is the worst i have ever heard, it has I say 3 songs that i actually like and there is only 10 of the songs repeating over and over again, you cant even inport your own music for the soundtrack, also when i said lastly i realized i had forgot a very inportant issue in this game, the lack of creation options is mindblowing, there is no create a diva, no create an arena, no create a title, no create a finisher, and the list just goes on and on and on.

Overall if you are a huge wrestling fan then i would suggested it to you as there is some fun to be had and its WWE on PC so yes there is mods for superstars if you know where to get them, but if you want to play this because its a sports games, well then you might be disappointed, I am hopeful however that we will get WWE 2K16 on PC next year and it sounds like there has been massive inprovements!

reviewText:
I've been playing WWE games since SvR 2007 and I've enjoyed playing these games for a long time. Being used to controls from the consoles, getting used to the keyboard controls was no easy task, since they are not even close to how a controller is, and more complex than MDickie's controls for his games. However, this game although stripped of a lot of what WWE 2K14 was, it still handles as a good WWE game.

The glitches I've seen in this game in videos, like the glitchy ring in the Redbox Replay moments are nonexistant for me and I haven't encountered any noticable bugs so far (of course at time of this review I haven't played much). I came in expecting a ♥♥♥♥ poor port, but the port is better than I expected and I'm satisfied.

The MyCareer mode is similar to a Career mode I remember from an old SvR game (07 I believe it was) where you try and bring your character to the top. Honestly a real refreshment from the WWE Universe mode where I try and bring a custom superstar to Raw and try and make him Champion.

This port is obviously not the best port in the world but I'd it a 6/10 due to it missing some matches that I do hold dear to my heart like the Inferno match and the removal of the Create an Arena option and the Create a Titantron Video. I'd honestly wait to see what 2K16 has to offer before picking this up if it ever gets a PC release (which I realllyyy hope it does)

reviewText:
Good game if you just want to catch up with WWE times and mess around with current day roster on the PC for those who don't have a nextgen console, you might enjoy it if you are just a casual gamer with wrestling games and just want to screw around on it.

Bad game if you run an e-fed, want customization and was hoping for some total revamps. Still only 25 caw slots like on nextgen consoles. I'm sure people will find ways to mod the game by twerking the .pac files in the game folders and do a lot of cool stuff, but it probably isn't worth it seeing how 2k16 will be out in about six months right now. I myself run an e-fed league on Twitch (have been since 2008) and might dabble in this to try and edit some stuff  in the game's folders but I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone who was hopefully looking for something new and better in terms of modding and customizing unless you really want to dig into the game's files and start messing around with .pac files.

If you don't care about any of that and just want to play the game for what it is and enjoy rasslin' with today's WWE wrestlers, then go for it, the graphics are pretty and the Universe mode is really fun to do. MyCareer can be fun and the online parts of the game (matches/custom) works well from what I tested it so far on release day.

reviewText:
I wanted to love this game.  I REALLY wanted to.  At current time, I cannot really recommend spending anywhere NEAR full price for this game.  Even for a crazy wrestling fan like me who has wanted a PC wrestling game since time immemorial it would seem, this was a disappointment.  I had heard of bugs, and features being a little bare in the console version of the game, and it's true there's a lot less here than there was in 2k14, with the exception of a couple of new modes like Career and Showcase.

I would find this backstep completely forgiveable except for one major thing:  Performance.  Bear in mind, some or all of these issues may be a case by case thing and you may have better results.  Overall, it runs okay, but with some notable problems:

- The ring and ropes are often blacked out, as if missing their textures.  Restarting the game usually fixes this.
- Sometimes when I launch the game, the launcher gets stuck in some kind of loop, restarting itself over and over until I exit Steam and restart it.  This broadcasts that you're playing WWE 2k15 to all your friends, over and over.
- Some of the load times are HORRENDOUS.  They are especially noticeable when I'm customizing my wrestler, and it takes all day to load up an elbow pad or something to customize.
- Game takes a while to start up, and does some weird stuff like start minimized, then come up windowed, then go fullscreen, then window itself again, then eventually correct itself.  Weird.
- Something feels off about the gameplay itself.  It doesn't seem to flow quite right.  Like maybe there's a little bit of lag but not enough to be glaringly obvious.  Not sure what this is.

Those are the primary things that come to mind, and I'll edit this if anything else major comes up.  Conversely, I'll update if any of this gets fixed.

On to the feature problems:
- Very few performance options in the launcher, almost no effect on my game so far
- No custom music
- Speaking of music, there's not a large selection that plays during gameplay, and it gets old really fast.  Can just mute and play something in the background though I guess.
- You can't create a female wrestler.  At all.
- Not as good a roster as '14.  Maybe I'm just spoiled.
- Less customization options all around.  DRASTICALLY so.
- Lots less match types and options.
- No Paige

It's not all bad though.  Some of the things I like:
- MODDABLE!!!  This means a lot of custom content, AND may mean fixes to various problems if they aren't patched!
- All DLC from the console version is coming for free (except for Paige, it seems)
- the Career mode seems really neat.  I haven't gotten far in it due to impatience with some of the loading and the previously mentioned lack of fluidity in the gameplay
- Some of the newer grappling mechanics seem alright, but maybe it's TOO much.  I'll leave it as a positive for now.
- It is the first WWE game (perhaps wrestling game at all) on PC in a very very long time.  So it's something.

Overall, I'm going to say don't buy this unless it's on a good sale.  Even if you're a die hard fan like I am.  I think the problems are equal parts with the game itself and with the port version as well.
HOPEFULLY '16 will be better and we'll get it on PC, as well.  In the meantime, I recommend grabbing 14 for whatever console you have.  Even the DLC on that is pretty good.

Again, my opinions are open to change if there are patches, improvements, or mods that fix issues.

reviewText: Much as I love WWE, don't bother with this one. My career is a joke, only feuds around one of three or four pay-per-views you pick, the rest are just matches against the same 7-10 wrestlers and 1-3 pre-built CAW's. Universe is the same here as in absolutely every other game, glitches abound ranging from rope problems, to Smackdown being held in Unknown, to the cage not rendering so your characters escape from an open ring by climbing the air. Mods may save this game but that's the only way it will really happen.

reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. But If you really, really want it, wait till it's atleast -75% because YUKE's/2K do not deserve your money for this shameful attempt of a wrestling game. WWE 2K15 might be one of the worst wrestling games I've played (and I've played a lot of them) and it's far from the glory days of No Mercy on N64 or even WWF Attitude on the original Playstation, or FPW series on GBA.

As of this moment you can't even enable blood on the career mode or even change the DIFFICULTY of the game! Not only that, the career mode ENDS when you win the Heavyweight Championship on RAW. Sometimes the storylines just suddenly drop without any resolution or you might end up facing the same wrestler 5 times out of 6 in the worst of times. The AI isn't all that bright either, I've seen some extremely dumb stuff, especially in tag matches.

The CAW -mode is lacking huge amounts of stuff, ranging from clothes, masks, facepaints etc., and even if it did have those, creating your wrestler is a pain in the ♥♥♥ due to the ridicolous loading times. I have an amazing computer and whenever I add or remove a part, no matter what it is, there's multiple seconds before the game is done loading, even when I've had the game installed on SSD. Simply unacceptable, creating your own CAW takes 35 to 45 minutes (or more) just because of the loading times. Horrible port.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. Make 2K realise that they have to step up in order for us to buy and play their games. When I first heard that this game was coming to PC I was thrilled, since the last wrestling game had been the WWE RAW series almost a decade ago. I don't usually preorder but on this case I did and man was I disappointed. 2/10. Saddened that the Steam refund hadn't been updated back when I bought this piece of ♥♥♥♥ of a game.

reviewText:
So I can't ask for a refund on this game but I bought it from a third party, so I'll just leave a review

This is probably an okay wrestling game, but I haven't seen much in the gameplay aside from glorified reaction commands.

These games have always been heralded as having amazing customization and that's been cut down almost considerably in this version. I was still able to make a goofy character, but there's a lack of body types, and a lack of female customs altogether.

If you're playing a female you can only fight other females, so essentially there's only 6 or so possible opponents. You can't do a career with a female character either.

This game runs really unnecessarily slow. I realize I don't meet the requirements but when only two models are on the screen, all the audience is taken out, and the game res is downsized I don't expect to be averaging 10fps either.

All that being said the roster is fairly big and there's a lot of customization items if you're willing to play that far.

reviewText:
WWE 2K15s biggest strenghts are the improvements to gameplay. With the introduction of stamina management, chain wrestling and momentum buildup, this game takes a huge step towards making the flow of a match more realistic whereas in older games you could just spam the same move 10 times in a row without any repercussions. So more realism, less arcade.

It is essentially a great game, but you have to cope with the removal of a lot of the standout modes from previous iterations like the story creator or the move editor. It feels like most of the developement time was spent on porting the game over to the new improved next gen engine, so a lot of those side features got kicked out, I really hope they make a comeback in 2K16, they are a major draw to the series and have provided some awesome community content (like VGCW on Twitch). Also the online modes are missing entrances which really sucks, hope they bring that back! Also at this point the roster feels super antiquated, so much has changed since they closed the deadline, yet you still have Seth Rollins and Dean Ambrose fighting for the Shield or Cody Rhodes as... Cody Rhodes and not Stardust.

The PC Port is alright alltho done with not much effort, it runs fine and there are some barebones options to tweak performance.

The PC version comes with all the DLC that got released on the console versions including the three additional Showcase storylines. It is a great mode in theory but ultimately I think all the storylines they chose this year were pretty lame and if youre really a wrestling fan you will wonder why they chose such irrelevant feuds to begin with and not something cooler.

It's alright, it's mainly for wrestling fans obviously but if you want to get into it, it's very accessible to new players especially thanks to the gameplay improvements.

BAH GAWD

reviewText: Stay away from this one! I bought this game on sale for $13, All DLC included. I remember being borderline obsessed with every wwf/wwe game that came out for playstation and ps2 as well as S. vs R. 2009. The old games were actually FUN, I even played them after my teenage self stopped watching wrestling. Anyway, This game looks gorgeous and 2K has an excellent rep. So I bought the game preparing for a blast of nostalgia. The game features many modes and an insane amount of customizable character options. It actually feels more like your playing one of their sports games. BUT the mechanics just don't work! The reversal/counter system is rediculous, the controls are choppy. There is a silly feature that plays almost like Rock, paper, scissors for grapples... And there was a glitch in changing the difficulty settings in certain modes. I gave it three hours thinking I would get used to everything, and when it would seem like I was destroying my opponent, he would pin me. No matter how much strength/stamina you have there is a bar with a press and release timed system, It is too fast at times and I lost matches with almost full health. Thanks for my first ever refund steam :) You rock.

reviewText:
WARNING: Buy it on consoles, and if you do, buy WWE 2K16. It's an improvement and the game can actually run at 60fps (consistently)! However, if you can pick this up cheap, it's worth it. You can still do MyCareer, but things with heavy crowds make the game slow down so slow no matter the card or settings. You'll have to turn down your settings (besides Resolution). If you want to maintain a steady framerate, do the following:

MSAA: Off
FXAA: On or Off

FXAA (fast Anti-Aliasing) is fine, but MSAA really destroys your frames, so don't enable it.

Rating: 8/10-Non-PC Issues
Rating: 7.5/10-MSAA/PC Issues
Buy WWE 2K16 instead, but it worth it to get the entire game and DLCs for $20 on a trustworthy external CD-Key website.

reviewText:
I've played plenty of previous WWE games on console and I've had some great memories, which vamped me to purchase this. Now though, I do love this franchise (but don't watch the show anymore, just the games) but I'm not going to be bias/untruthful. With that being said, lets go to the pros.

PROS:
1. New Roster for Recent new wrestlers
2. They re-added a somewhat story mode (Career Mode) for created wrestlers.
3. Its on PC. (Sorry, but it is the only WWE game for PC LITERALLY)

Now time to roast this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.
Cons:
1. ONLINE MATCHMAKING IS ♥♥♥! When I say this, I'm not saying you can't play online, but the way to do so is so confusing and complicated. you go online, select your favorite wrestlers (Male and Diva), favorite arena and prefered matches (ranks, casual, type of match, etc.) and from then on you simply wait. I feel as though there should have been a button or even a selection to go search for matches, plus there really aren't that many people online in the first place, so its going to take forever to find a match.
2. Customization Selection is weak. You used to have a wider variety to pick when It came to clothing, hair, and facial hair for a character (being the casual black man I am, I usually get a buzz cut or braids and neither were available. The best hair they had for my character was dreads, so I pretty much had a kick-boxing Chief Keef).
3. WTF Finishers. There have been multiple time where I was charging a finisher and my opponent just simply wouldn't get up. Or the on TOO MANY occasions where my signature would be the spear from the corner, the opponent gets up, I run for the spear, I touch him, but it doesn't land, and my signature gone. Or even worst, where I had a finisher hit on me by an AI and we both froze (at the time, this was a fatal 4 match) and WE ♥♥♥♥ING LOST BECAUSE OF IT. Fix that ♥♥♥♥ man.
4.Did I mention the customization was weak. I'm sorry if I'm repeating, but you gotta understand that the character creation is the reason why majority of people buy the game, and its weak AF! Even the cool designs they used to have are gone, though a few are left. Also, its PC, why THE LITERAL ♥♥♥♥ is it so hard to make it able to put your own music into your entrance, like come on.
5. Career Mode is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. I pretty much won majority ( and a high majority at that) of my matches. Even the ones that had me in the ring with 4 people, but I digress. And for the majority, I was the Heel. Luckily, I read in a community Guide that there were a lot of things I wasn't suppose to do, So i would check that out before getting into career mode. Also, after I won the WWE Championship, it pushes ahead 10 years, And I'm retiring automatically. WTF?!?! I didn't even have the belt anymore, are you telling me I did all that, just to hold that belt for about 2 seconds just to fast foward my way out of it. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.
6. 60 FPS Lock. IDK why, but its there and its obvious. Though, not a huge con, I've seen fram dips and I know for a fact my PC can run this game like a champ. <<< See what I did there XD

Final Verdict:
$50!?!?! Are you ♥♥♥♥ing kidding me?!?!?! Catch it on sale or just wait for the price drop, i got it for about $15. And though it wasn't $50, I'm honestly not satisfied that I got a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ product. If you not a wrestling fan, don't even think about buying this ♥♥♥♥.

reviewText:
Pros:
This is a very fun game
I love the career mode
Finally WWE on PC
**Bonus** Free DLC content (had to pay for DLC on the other versions)
You can mod the game, but it's not easy.
You can change the Titantrons, by modding in newer versions. (Programs available for this)
2K Showcase is a lot of fun, I just wish they had more.
Love the Rivalries
Love Universe mode

Cons:
Bugs (some stop the AI completely, making it impossible to fight, forcing you to quit out, and lose everything)
Some content has been removed from the game.
Where the hell is Paige
No Steam Workplace support
Would be nice to see a lot more WWE/NXT Divas, in the future.
The game is unable to keep up with WWE stories, and therefore feels outdated.
The reversals could use some toning down a bit.
Needs the ability to change, more difficulty settings. Changing settings now, doesn't seem to help story mode.

Future game wishes:
** I really hope 2K ports WWE 2K16 to PC. Please 2K Games, please do this for us. Thanks so much for bringing WWE 2K15 over to the PC. Also non-wrestling related 2K please make NHL 2K games for PC. Thanks so much :)

reviewText: While this game includes a much needed graphical update to the series, it lacks: customization for divas; fine tuned entrances; customization for entrance music; many costume pieces from past games, and most importantly, the story creator mode.\n\nThe main reason I was interested in this game was so that I could get started making VGCW style tournaments and such, and the lack of the story creator is baffling. It was clearly the best part of the game, and yet there isn't even a vestige of it left. As it stands, this is a subpar fighting game with far more limited character creation than the last entries in the series. There is no reason to choose this over WWE2K14. Hopefully, when they finally get around to making WWE2K16, the developers will reinsert all the missing content.

For me, I'm more of a WCW vs. NWO: World Tour kind of guy than this kind of reversal, button-masher of a game in WWE 2K15.  It seems as if too much of fighting is simply pressing the reversal button at the right time, or messing with the silly endless grapples, and if you aren't great at that, you can get locked in a loop of damage.  You seem to fall to the mat and stay there for the most simple of hits, allowing your opponent too much of an advantage and vice versa if you get too far ahead yourself.  It makes for frustrating gameplay.

The graphics aren't that great, especially the walking movements of the characters, which feels especially stiff and awkward during player introductions.  The announcing leaves you with moments of silence that feel awkward.  The end game highlights are reintroduced as highlights" every time a new highlight is shown
date: as if you forgot you're watching...highlights.  This game is really as bad as everyone has said it is.\n\nI decided to get WWE 2K15 for the sale
recommended: but even at $17 it feels like a rip off.  There are a ton of cool wrestlers and things to unlock
hoursPlayed: and tons of cool mods to look through
voteText: but the fighting system is fairly awful.  I'll give it a little more time just to experience the different modes
helpfulPercent: but I think I'll hold off on considering a PC wrestling game for awhile after this experience."

reviewText: Rating: 7/10\n\nFirst and foremost, let me introduce myself as a big WWE fan. I have been playing WWE games on my PlayStation 1 and 2 for thousands of hours and have not been tired of it. The newer WWE games were the only reason why I wanted to purchase the newer consoles but I just derived satisfaction from games like SmackDown! Here Comes the Pain, which still remains as the best WWE game to date. WWE 2K15 was a game that recieved a scathing critic score because of its lack of content and therefore I believe WWE and 2K found it wise to port it to the PC (As we are second rate consumers, after all). But hey, I still got happy as a baby when I found out I will be able to play a recent WWE iteration without having to buy a console. After purchasing and playing the game for a considerable period of time (As you can see), I would say this game is well worth a purchase at a discount. The graphics are a massive improvement over the previous games, though some wrestlers look hideous, but that they always did. Triple H for instance has been done well for the first time as Yukes always found it difficult to model his face in the previous iterations. The gameplay is responsive and enjoyable, but the reversal system has been made extremely frustrating as you are bound to be Too late" or "Too fast" with your response
date: which is quite stupid if you ask me. The roster is laughable at best but the added DLC's kinda make up for it. I for instance only cared for a few wrestlers I love playing as
recommended: and all of them are there in the game (A WWE game without Stone Cold/Kane/Undertaker/The Rock is not a WWE game). I also found a distinct lack of environments as all action is at the ring side. I loved the vivid backstage locations in SmackDown! Here Comes the Pain and was gutted to see 2K/Yukes not bother to add them in this iteration despite the big 30GB download size."

reviewText:
WWE 2k15 is the best wrestling game on the PC to date. While it is mediocre compared to older games on consoles in it's plain form, client-side modifications make the game the definite edition and pretty good, as the community is constantly updating wrestlers, adding new attires, there are tools to change entrance music, titantron videos, all NPCs (like the Rosebud called Bunny) can be unlocked and the modding community has just begun actually adding new wrestlers to the roster as well instead of just replacing them. The game hasn't been out for long, thus there are likely much better things to come.

The PC version also has more CAW slots than the console counterpart and also comes with some updated Titantrons since the DLC.

The price is nice, especially during sales, as the game comes with all DLC (except Paige - but the modding community is close to release Paige that looks even better than the Xbox One/PS4 version of Paige as well) for free.

Gameplay is at a slower pace and more timing-based than it's console-exclusive predecessors. At first it's a bit tricky to adapt, but once you have played it a bit, you'll notice that it feels alot more like a wrestling simulation than most of the more arcady predecessors.

The game modes are all entertaining. The wonderful 2k Showcases which allow you to replay famous feuds and careers of the past, over the enjoyable My Career mode where your friends' career mode wrestlers can invade, to the customizable WWE Universe mode which allows you to manage rosters, book shows and play as well as the obligatory exhibition mode (which is a bit limited in match types - however, more can already be unlocked via trainers and memory editing).

Online Multiplayer isn't all that exciting and matchmaking is rather awkward, the game is best played with 1-6 players locally.

While the game supports keyboard controls, it's highly recommended to use a gamepad like the Xbox One, Xbox 360 or DualShock 4 Controller (with DS4Windows to emulate an Xbox controller for Windows) as it's just alot more intuitive and easier to play that way. The game supports up to 6+ input devices in total, so 6 players can play locally (6 wrestlers on screen at once are the maximum, hence the limit), just like on the Xbox One (The PS4 version only supports 4 players as the console only supports 4 controllers at once).

The roster is pretty large and most big names are in it. With the DLC it also has a good mix of current wrestlers and legends, although some of the wrestlers that became stars after the game was originally released are not in it. But you can either download mods to add them, download CAWs and updated attires from community creations and more, so most of the current fan-favorites (from NXT, for example) can be added to the game one way or the other.

Note that the game is quite hardware-hungry, however. So you better meet the minimum or better, recommended requirements. A beefy multi-core CPU, 4+GB of RAM, and a higher mid-class video card with at least 2GB of memory and a fast HDD or better, an SSD to run the game from are a must.

WWE 2k15 doesn't have any profiles in Nvidia or AMD video card drivers (I guess 2k didn't want to pay them to include them and neither Nvidia nor AMD can be ar$ed to add support for games from publishers that don't sponsor them). Thus SLI and CrossfireX don't work out of the box. One has to create their own profiles for it, but once they are made, multi-GPU setups scale really well and increas performance immensely.
Nvidia SLI users will want to use Nvidia Inspector to set SLI Compatibility bits (DX1x) to 0x000025F5 (alternatively 0x000015F5 that seems to work better if you have a lower-end SLI system), while AMD CrossfireX users will want to create a custom Profile for the game in Catalyst Control center and force CrossfireX Mode to the AFR friendly" setting.

In any case
date: I highly recommend WWE 2k15 to every wrestling fan with the hardware that can run it
recommended: even if you already own it on consoles
hoursPlayed: as the PC version is simply better due to small improvements as well as modifications."
