reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. You will be disappointed. I will go with pros and cons and start with cons first.

CONS:
-MINI-GAMES???? Holy hell. I just wanted to get in the ring and fight. I wanted to throw down some awesome body slams and power bombs, maybe irish whip a fool and then clothesline him. Guess what....you have to play some terrible mini-game to pull off moves and maybe that could work, but these games suck. You are not going to go in the ring and grab your opponent and do an awesome move, so get that out of your head. This alone right here should make you stop and say NO, not going to buy it.
-CLUNKY....everything is clunky. This plays like a terrible PC port because that is what it is. Every control from superstar creation to in ring game play is awkward and clumsy to the extreme to the point of being near unplayable.
-Limited Creative Options - love making your own superstar with awesome moves and entrance? You will get only about half that experience here and be angry in the end for it.
-IT JUST WAS NOT FUN - and because of all the things above and more.....the game just wasn't fun. Got my refund and regretted ever buying it.

PROS:
-It's a wrestling game on PC. And we've been wanting one for a while. Just not this one.
-Nice Roster with some blasts from the past.
-Graphics --this is actually a very beautiful game. Maybe not perfect, but surely it gives a 'next generation' vibe.
*that's about it for PROS. A nice roster and it looks nice. THAT'S IT.

2/10 - HATE #$%@#$@#$ MINI GAMES, JUST WANT TO MAKE MY BAD ♥♥♥ SUPERSTAR AND THROW DOWN SOME AWESOME MOVES. HATE THIS GAME!

reviewText: WWE 2K15 Review\nI find that WWE 2K15 falls short of its THQ predecessors. It does this in many, many ways. Firstly, the story mode has no flavor to it. It's mostly grinding social media followers by doing token matches to advance through the story and get to the real meat and potatoes (or just potatoes if you're vegan) of the game, getting a title shot. There are a LOT of different moves to use (pretty much 4 for almost every thinkable position a superstar can be in in relation to another superstar) and they give you a TON of different moves to chose from, but trying to remember all those moves that you picked and which situation to use them in is very difficult for the average player. You end up mostly just sticking to some tried and true moves that you can remember easily, which the game penalizes you for in Skill Points (SP) for lacking variety" during the match. The engine is REALLY nice with very photorealistic versions of many superstars and several fails on others (The Miz was one that stood out as a bad model) but even on computers that are running well above the recommended stats
date: you're chugging and you have to pause/unpause the game to get some relief. At its core
recommended:
it's still a fairly fun games in bursts and having a friend's created superstar be matched against you in a PPV match in your story mode is pretty awesome!

Pros Great engine
Lots of moves to pick from
"Invading" friends is a lot of fun!
Still fun in bursts
Cons Poorly optimized even on high-end PCs
Story mode is slow and grindy
Controls are really awkward and hard to remember
A little too much realism interferes with creation/combat
Final RecommendationBuy it on sale (at least 33%
hoursPlayed: better at 50%+). You get all the DLC for free and if you have friends who play

reviewText:
WWE 2k15 for the PC is a right that has corrected a wrong....with experience that is.  Everything in this game is outdated and the customization is a bit lax.  You can import your own logos and faces through 2K's Import feature and finally change the attire of every single person in game....but custom music has been removed.

I say that WWE 2k15 is a right that has corrected a wrong....with experience, because with the addition to PC you can change almost every aspect of the game with the help of mods.  There are some beautiful mods out there for this game and even greater changes coming soon.  Adding new titantrons, new character skins, and new belt designs are a breeze, but the methods to change minitron/walltrons is a pain.  There also isn't any additional space for added trons meaning that you have to overwrite already established ones.

Gameplay wise, you have to have a pretty decent gaming rig to run the game, there are low res programs to help run the game on low end computers but it's like playing WWE on Playstation 2.  There is still a bit of lag but having owned the xbox and xbox one version of the game, it's a bit faster response compared to those consoles.

Overall, I recommend the game for the die hard WWE fan, with a few corrections you can have fun playing the game and it will sustain you until WWE 2K16 releases.  Happy Gaming!

reviewText:
WWE 2k15 is the best wrestling game on the PC to date. While it is mediocre compared to older games on consoles in it's plain form, client-side modifications make the game the definite edition and pretty good, as the community is constantly updating wrestlers, adding new attires, there are tools to change entrance music, titantron videos, all NPCs (like the Rosebud called Bunny) can be unlocked and the modding community has just begun actually adding new wrestlers to the roster as well instead of just replacing them. The game hasn't been out for long, thus there are likely much better things to come.

The PC version also has more CAW slots than the console counterpart and also comes with some updated Titantrons since the DLC.

The price is nice, especially during sales, as the game comes with all DLC (except Paige - but the modding community is close to release Paige that looks even better than the Xbox One/PS4 version of Paige as well) for free.

Gameplay is at a slower pace and more timing-based than it's console-exclusive predecessors. At first it's a bit tricky to adapt, but once you have played it a bit, you'll notice that it feels alot more like a wrestling simulation than most of the more arcady predecessors.

The game modes are all entertaining. The wonderful 2k Showcases which allow you to replay famous feuds and careers of the past, over the enjoyable My Career mode where your friends' career mode wrestlers can invade, to the customizable WWE Universe mode which allows you to manage rosters, book shows and play as well as the obligatory exhibition mode (which is a bit limited in match types - however, more can already be unlocked via trainers and memory editing).

Online Multiplayer isn't all that exciting and matchmaking is rather awkward, the game is best played with 1-6 players locally.

While the game supports keyboard controls, it's highly recommended to use a gamepad like the Xbox One, Xbox 360 or DualShock 4 Controller (with DS4Windows to emulate an Xbox controller for Windows) as it's just alot more intuitive and easier to play that way. The game supports up to 6+ input devices in total, so 6 players can play locally (6 wrestlers on screen at once are the maximum, hence the limit), just like on the Xbox One (The PS4 version only supports 4 players as the console only supports 4 controllers at once).

The roster is pretty large and most big names are in it. With the DLC it also has a good mix of current wrestlers and legends, although some of the wrestlers that became stars after the game was originally released are not in it. But you can either download mods to add them, download CAWs and updated attires from community creations and more, so most of the current fan-favorites (from NXT, for example) can be added to the game one way or the other.

Note that the game is quite hardware-hungry, however. So you better meet the minimum or better, recommended requirements. A beefy multi-core CPU, 4+GB of RAM, and a higher mid-class video card with at least 2GB of memory and a fast HDD or better, an SSD to run the game from are a must.

WWE 2k15 doesn't have any profiles in Nvidia or AMD video card drivers (I guess 2k didn't want to pay them to include them and neither Nvidia nor AMD can be ar$ed to add support for games from publishers that don't sponsor them). Thus SLI and CrossfireX don't work out of the box. One has to create their own profiles for it, but once they are made, multi-GPU setups scale really well and increas performance immensely.
Nvidia SLI users will want to use Nvidia Inspector to set SLI Compatibility bits (DX1x) to 0x000025F5 (alternatively 0x000015F5 that seems to work better if you have a lower-end SLI system), while AMD CrossfireX users will want to create a custom Profile for the game in Catalyst Control center and force CrossfireX Mode to the AFR friendly" setting.

In any case
date: I highly recommend WWE 2k15 to every wrestling fan with the hardware that can run it
recommended: even if you already own it on consoles
hoursPlayed: as the PC version is simply better due to small improvements as well as modifications."

reviewText:
Okay, so I'm just coming from the most amazing wrestling match that has ever seen the day of light so this might not be the most objective review...
But let me tell you what you can expect and what you should not expect (skip to the bottom if you are not into reading my story):

I bought this game at a steamsale for ~17€... and after looking at only 66% positive reviews i was really sceptic!
So I went in not expecting much, which is why I got my moneys worth!
I played SvR 08-11 on PS2 and SvR08 (cause of career) on an emulator until present day.


I read that this game has an awesome soundtrack... and let me tell you: They are all right! One of the best soundtracks ever in a fighting game!
Graphics are extremly nice! They probably could be better... since svr08 was 7 years ago... but they hold up.
Animations are really sluggish... they often feel unrealistic or better stupid... superstars doing 360° walk around a grounded opponent to pin him and then becoming superhuman and laying on him nearly instantly... many animations are just way to fast to compensate for the reversal system...

Which brings me to:
Gameplay... probably the biggest factor:
Its really nice! I miss some features of the older games... and trying to target the other tagopponent behind the ropes is A PAIN! I sometimes tried ~1hour to get the doublefinisher omg moment, just because i couldn't get both tag team partners in the ring at the same moment.
but superstars interact more realistic with the environment and overall its very solid and fun gameplay.

If you had a SvR game for Ps2 but never bought the newer consoles... this is the game for you. Maybe wait until its on sale again, but the offline MyCareer" mode is completly worth on its own.

Now let me tell you the story of my match:
I had to face r-truth the current tag team champion in a 1-1... I won easily... but next weak i had to face him again. His partner came with a steel chair after me so i started with yellow bodyparts and lower stamina... the match went okay
date:
but it got close once.
After this Vickie just said "oh hey i hope you don't mind im putting you at a 1vs2 tag handicap match have fun with that.
And since my superstar isn't high level this could get some trouble... but after smashing his partner through the announcment table this was a kinda easy match.
After this Vickie said "well since you did so well decide if you want 1v1 2v2 or a 1v2 again at the pvp. I chose the 1v2 since my Devil could handle it (i thought)
So i thought to myself "lets do the double FU (i think its called attitude adjustment or something nowadays) it will be fun!"
ohhh the horror! As i wrote earlier:
its a pain to grab the tag partner that is currently not in the ring. so after i saved three finishers i tried to get both in a corner and failing a lot... 3 of my bodyparts were red when i got hit by two of r-truths finishers and 3 signature moves...
how i kicked out? i don't know! last time i kicked out
recommended:
the bar was like this  | | ... but i kicked out at 2.9 seconds (3rd try)...
and i finally got the double FU off!
But now his partner activated his comeback and got me another finisher... i was broken... i had no chance of hitting | this time... ROPE BREAK! I felt i had only one chance left! Since my Pins after a finisher were broken two times by the tagpartner... i felt now has the time come: i used hells gate! i had the victory for sure! the submission bar was filled! I was in joy all ove...-
WHAT?!?! R-Truth kicked him out at the very
hoursPlayed:
very last second!
Now his mate got up before me... tagged with R-Truth... but completly KO only hung in the ropes after the tag. Unable to get a hold of himself.
I saw my chance! I still had one finisher left inside me! I countered his grab and pushed him down and went for the Hells Gate again! And as i saw the hands of R-Truth hitting the map for submission i knew:

I AM GOING TO RECOMMEND THIS GAME! AND I WILL TELL MY STORY!
____________________________________________________________

Long story short:
+graphics |  it looks nice... but could have been better
+audio | one of the best tracks out there! awesome
+story mode | finally you can create your own story with your own superstar again

+- gameplay | feels sluggish sometimes... other times really fluent...
+- quite a lot is missing or has been replaced! for instance: i never know if DQ is on or off... you simply can't look it up in the match itself. but slamming someone through the barricade is SO satisfying!

- console port! i have a very good pc that can play Shadow of Mordor on Ultra without any lags... but i still have to set some options down for it not to lag.
- it could have been a better game! 7 years after SvR 08... It is still not much

reviewText:
This is a game were I wished thre was a 'maybe' category.

The gameplay is fun, visuals good etc but the control mechanics are too punishing.

You have a split second to hit your counter button and if you miss, you take a power of punishment.  I have read people saying you get to learn when your opponent is about to strick and get better at timming your reversals and I agree, with practice you become much better at it, but it's still very hard.  Not only that, you find yourself losing matches because when pinned you have to hit a sweet spot in order to kick out of it. That sweet spot gets smaller the more injured you are (which makes sense) but I've found myself losing matches to this mechanic after I've pulverised my opponent to low health only to miss a few reversals then get pinned and miss the kickout sweet spot.

All in all this game could be so much more enjoyable if it wasn't so punishing for mistakes. Lightning reflexes are required in this game.

If you wan't to feel like a powerful WWE wrestler, avoid this game.

voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. You will be disappointed. I will go with pros and cons and start with cons first.

CONS:
-MINI-GAMES???? Holy hell. I just wanted to get in the ring and fight. I wanted to throw down some awesome body slams and power bombs, maybe irish whip a fool and then clothesline him. Guess what....you have to play some terrible mini-game to pull off moves and maybe that could work, but these games suck. You are not going to go in the ring and grab your opponent and do an awesome move, so get that out of your head. This alone right here should make you stop and say NO, not going to buy it.
-CLUNKY....everything is clunky. This plays like a terrible PC port because that is what it is. Every control from superstar creation to in ring game play is awkward and clumsy to the extreme to the point of being near unplayable.
-Limited Creative Options - love making your own superstar with awesome moves and entrance? You will get only about half that experience here and be angry in the end for it.
-IT JUST WAS NOT FUN - and because of all the things above and more.....the game just wasn't fun. Got my refund and regretted ever buying it.

PROS:
-It's a wrestling game on PC. And we've been wanting one for a while. Just not this one.
-Nice Roster with some blasts from the past.
-Graphics --this is actually a very beautiful game. Maybe not perfect, but surely it gives a 'next generation' vibe.
*that's about it for PROS. A nice roster and it looks nice. THAT'S IT.

2/10 - HATE #$%@#$@#$ MINI GAMES, JUST WANT TO MAKE MY BAD ♥♥♥ SUPERSTAR AND THROW DOWN SOME AWESOME MOVES. HATE THIS GAME!

reviewText: ok i had to play for some time to make a legit review and here is what i think i started with keyboard like im sure most will and after losing my damn mind trying to figure it out (since there is no tutorial and i havent played a wrestling game in prolly 10 years) i decided to use my ps controller ok much better but after a few more hours of game play i wanted to smash my fist thru my monitor the game is ok and has decent detail into the wrestlers but the controls and grapple thing that they have is annoying as heck plus you cant turn it off in career mode . also in career mode u cannot change the difficulty or change any settings so your stuck with it weather your a veteran or a rookie like me. another thing is with no tutorial it took me a full day to get basic moves down and having to search the internet for any info is like pulling teeth. long story short if u get it 75% off i feel its ok and a decent deal any other price forget it i wouldnt waste the money get it on console or get 2k16

reviewText:
The graphics are amazing, but serious lag hurts the gameplay, even with V-Sync turned off. My Career is there, which is something I did not have on the xbox 360 version, but the advertised DLCs are not.

One of the first things I checked on was the difference between Create a Diva on this game and the 360 version, but I could not figure out how to create an actual diva. Haven't seen a single picture of a created diva for this game online either.

So, I went looking for anwers right away, but I found some forums that say Create a Diva has been deleted from the game. There are not enough divas in the game, and I made a few on the 360 version to fix this, but I can't seem to make one on the PC version.

If Create a Diva really is removed, I will sadly be playing the 360 version sooner than the Steam version. Now that I have GTA5, I doubt either version will be turned back on ever again. I should not have to choose between a version that has Create a Diva (instant winner), or a version that has My Career (why I bought it on PC). Another main reason I bought it on PC was to see improvements on created characters.

Made an actual Show for just the divas on 360, and made 5 custom divas, along with the Female Hardcore Championship. Gone?

Unless they add it back in, this is Not Recommended. Too big of a sacrifice from the 360 version. I know people will be all It's wrestling! It's for men!"

reviewText:
With the lack of mma and boxing games on pc I thought I would resort to wrestling. The graphics are decent on this game. The combat took a little while to get used to. I don't like that you need to counter in order to stand up.
I didn't like that once you get the world championship belt it finishes your career.
I didn't like that you very rarely get to chose the type of match you compete in. I would have liked more NO dq, tlc or other special matches. Couldn't believe I went the whole career without ever being in a cage, chamber or royal rumble match.
I did like the heel/ face system but it needed more options to lean more towards one or the other.
Also I couldn't climb into the crowd or go to other parts of the stadium. And I'm probably just stupid but couldn't suplex on to commentaters desk.
Overall I give this a 5/10. I remember playing wrestling games on ps1 and ps2 that design wise were way better then this but just lacked the graphics.

reviewText:
Worst game I've ever purchased, a complete waste of money.
First of all, everytime I play a WWE game, I always go straight to the career mode. This one is extremely tedious and quite difficult. There isn't a point to the storyline.

I am so dissapointed with this game, I really wish I hadn't spent $50 on it.

reviewText: While I have put many hours into this game, I simply cannot recommend it. The game is poorly optimized which means that the gameplay suffers. When I reverse when prompting, most of the times it claims I did it too early. You also notice that it's poorly optimized when the framerate suffers when you're doing certain moves. From a smooth framerate, it gets slow and sometimes choppy. After the animation, it gets back to normal.\n\nThe rest of the game seems okay, though a lot of the options from the previous games have been stripped. Gone is the create-a-diva, gone is the create-an-arena (though I don't really miss that one), gone are most of the create-a-wrestler options. What you get is a bare-bone game. I do not recommend this game.

reviewText: First I want to say that I am amazed that WWE2K15 came to the pc. Just the fact that there is a wrestling game thats up to date makes my day. Great control sceme. reviewText:
This game is more for the serious kind of wrestling fans. You aren´t going to be able to create a demon or whatever you could in the previous games. Nor create an entrance video, nor a custom finnishing move. But the gameplay has improved alot. It gives you a more realistic gameplay with small changes that makes the game more real. Like the stamina bar for example.
After you hit your big move on your opponent, if your stamina is low you will fall to your knees to take a breath.
Another change is that whenever you take a grapple move, the computer will read where you can do it without interfearence with ropes, etc. So your character automaticly drags the opponent to a place where the ropes doesn´t hit him.
The animations and graphics are also really good.
Also the career mode is interesting. You make your own character which you go up the ranks from NXT to raw.

reviewText:
What can I say about WWE 2K15? Without a doubt the worst ‘game’ (I will use this term loosely) I've ever played.

Let’s start with the graphics. They're nice, run smoothly and are actually quite detailed. This is definitely the prettiest WWE game to date and I think the developers have done a wonderful job there. But what is the point of a game looking aesthetically pleasing if the mechanics are so rudimentary that they've somehow managed to script and add more taunting buttons than actual fighting/action buttons.

I can only gather someone in the development team after intravenously absorbing multiple narcotics had wastefully decided to invest thousands of hours on the finite details of muscular definition and the high-definition photographic work of John Cena in the loading screens as opposed to focusing on the actual mechanically purpose and necessity of the game; which is to simulate being a wrestler immersed in the WWE universe. I technically can control a cactus’ growth more than I can control the fighting mechanics in this ‘game’. How ironic is it that WWE 2K15 has, to me, turned out to be just as fundamentally disappointing, timewasting and unentertaining as the real show that plagues FOX8 on a weekly basis.
Absolutely do not waste your money investing into this failed project which I hope with abundant optimism will fade into the trashy history of this century as nothing more than a redneck themed, trash sport who made a bratty, capitalist family rich enough to pile more food onto their silver spoons.

In summary, I'll rate this 'game' 0.5/10, with half a mark amounting to the detail of John Cena's skin in the loading screen.

reviewText:
Where do I begin?  I found absolutely no redeeming qualities to this pile of garbage.

The new chain wrestling system is terrible.  When you start a chain-wrestling sequence, you basically play rock, paper, scissors to see who gets to do a move.  Then, you play a little minigame where you move the stick until a red dot appears, then hold that position till the red dot gets bigger.  Whoever's red dot fills up quickest either does a move (offense) or breaks out (defense).  SO MUCH FUN I CAN'T TAKE IT.

The graphics are worse than older iterations of WWE games (seriously, SvR 2k7 looked way better), and certainly not on par with current-generation games.  Load times are way too long, even on a high-end system.

Character creation is particularly lame.  Previous WWE games had some seriously deep character customization, whereas this one allows you to select from like 5 or 6 masks.  No options whatsoever to add a voice to your character.  Also, you can't create a female wrestler...only modify existing ones.

The music selection is absolute crap, but sadly that's expected...WWE doesn't have a great track record (with me, at least) on music.

This has the distinction of being the first game I've asked for a refund on.  Right at the 2 hour mark on play time...hoping I'm not stuck with this waste of hard drive space.

reviewText:
Where do I begin?  I found absolutely no redeeming qualities to this pile of garbage.

The new chain wrestling system is terrible.  When you start a chain-wrestling sequence, you basically play rock, paper, scissors to see who gets to do a move.  Then, you play a little minigame where you move the stick until a red dot appears, then hold that position till the red dot gets bigger.  Whoever's red dot fills up quickest either does a move (offense) or breaks out (defense).  SO MUCH FUN I CAN'T TAKE IT.

The graphics are worse than older iterations of WWE games (seriously, SvR 2k7 looked way better), and certainly not on par with current-generation games.  Load times are way too long, even on a high-end system.

Character creation is particularly lame.  Previous WWE games had some seriously deep character customization, whereas this one allows you to select from like 5 or 6 masks.  No options whatsoever to add a voice to your character.  Also, you can't create a female wrestler...only modify existing ones.

The music selection is absolute crap, but sadly that's expected...WWE doesn't have a great track record (with me, at least) on music.

This has the distinction of being the first game I've asked for a refund on.  Right at the 2 hour mark on play time...hoping I'm not stuck with this waste of hard drive space.

reviewText:
What can I say about WWE 2K15? Without a doubt the worst ‘game’ (I will use this term loosely) I've ever played.

Let’s start with the graphics. They're nice, run smoothly and are actually quite detailed. This is definitely the prettiest WWE game to date and I think the developers have done a wonderful job there. But what is the point of a game looking aesthetically pleasing if the mechanics are so rudimentary that they've somehow managed to script and add more taunting buttons than actual fighting/action buttons.

I can only gather someone in the development team after intravenously absorbing multiple narcotics had wastefully decided to invest thousands of hours on the finite details of muscular definition and the high-definition photographic work of John Cena in the loading screens as opposed to focusing on the actual mechanically purpose and necessity of the game; which is to simulate being a wrestler immersed in the WWE universe. I technically can control a cactus’ growth more than I can control the fighting mechanics in this ‘game’. How ironic is it that WWE 2K15 has, to me, turned out to be just as fundamentally disappointing, timewasting and unentertaining as the real show that plagues FOX8 on a weekly basis.
Absolutely do not waste your money investing into this failed project which I hope with abundant optimism will fade into the trashy history of this century as nothing more than a redneck themed, trash sport who made a bratty, capitalist family rich enough to pile more food onto their silver spoons.

In summary, I'll rate this 'game' 0.5/10, with half a mark amounting to the detail of John Cena's skin in the loading screen.

reviewText:
There is so little to customize in here....
Honestly, that's the whole reason people want to be able to play games like this. They want to look and FEEL like a superstar of their OWN looks, not by having only a handful of pre-selected options. There's really not too much in the way of customizing anything, which really, really puts a damper on the experience IMO.
Unless I am missing something, but I'd really like there to be a bit more variety in the hairstyles I can select and the clothes I can wear.

Where are the old days of Day of Wreckoning? Where are all the options from WWE2K14? I personally felt that that was what made the game so great.
It had a number of options and the character I could make in there was very close to how I look in real life. I don't nearly get that same feeling here, which is what disappoints me greatly.

I know I'll have fun with this game, but it's this one aspect of the game which will reduce my overall fun I will have in the long run. Especially when it comes to the visuals...
That's key, WWE.

reviewText: First off - continuous rap/country music background! Annoying if you don't like rap or country. (I like classic rock and 80s metal thanks.)  Limited number of wrestlers, mostly of the new school. Outside of Ultimate Warrior, hardly any old favorite classic wreslters. Wrestler creation is extremely difficult. Wrestler creation plain sucks overall since I don't see how I can get the models to take on the appearances of oldschool wrestlers I like. All sample designs are based on modern/current WWE lineup. GAMEPLAY is tough and hard to figure out controls. It seems you would need a college degree to figure out the correct way to work the buttons just to do simple punches, kicks, grabs, slams, etc. as opposed to older wrestling games. There are several locked wrestlers and options I will never be able to access simply because I can't figure out how to wrestle" on this stupid thing. Overall- this game sucks. reviewText:
First of all, This game is Great, and hell yea It's worth the money, I'll put Pros & Cons below, make sure you check them out before you buy the game, as myself i love the game but it has bad optimization and many bugs, I'll give it some time hopefully it'll be fixed. Also not only the DLC is Free but there's also Upcoming DLC that'll include Paige for FREE!

Pros:
- Great Graphics
- Modable (Soon you'll be able to add custom songs)
- There's alot to do
- Free DLC's
- Complicated but Logically Good Controlls on Keyboard (Personaly using Controller)

Cons:
- Bad Optimization
- Non-Realistic Superstars, example CM Punk looks like Michael from GTA V
- No Graphic Customization
- Tons of Bugs
- Freezing Character Lags, even that i never go below 60fps

Hopefully this review will help you, i say buy it, but my review will be negative as now.

reviewText:
No Arcade Controls.  No action. You are pretty much playing minigames. The old style of arcade controls, where you feel real action and engagement is gone. You have to play these minigames for everything - you grab someone and wanna do a move on them, so you have to play the minigame.

When opponents do moves on you, all you can do is get beat down until you reversal. At higher difficulty every move misses and all damage comes from reversals and occasional moves that were lucky to land. It becomes a reversalfest, and gets very old very quickly.

This does not engage or feel like wrestling" it feels like waiting for the right moment to press the right button at the right time
date: like Guitar Hero or Guitaroo Man.  This is really just skaing on ice.\n\nNow
recommended: to rub salt in the eyes
hoursPlayed: you CANNOT change any  of this. Most game modes force you to use all default options
voteText: so you don't get to play how you want - you only play how you are told. Which means no blood

no making it harder (or easier).

There are also many pieces of missing content because this was ported from the PS4 version. The PS3 version of this game provides quite a few more match types and CAW options.

holding a submission made you lose Stamina.

Your opponent does not have any reversal chance during a submission.
In prior games

submissions could be reversed mid-move.

Opponent submissions zip to tapout really fast.

Submissions take you from no limb damage to orange immediately
column16:
with max sub defense.
This isn't much fun.

Rope Breaks force you to let go immediately.
In prior games
column18:
you "can" hold up to 5 seconds before DQ.

You cannot make your Tag Team partner help you.

column25:
there was actual difficulty.
This game is just like skating on ice and doesn't feel like wrestling.
The controls are borky and all the minigames are a no-fun headache.

reviewText: I fought through 9 hours of this game, and I learned that the rest of the reviews were correct. This is by far the worst game that WWE has come out with. There's no storyline like their used to be. The controls are difficult to even moderately grasp. The character selection is minimal. The lack of music on the game is disturbing, and the tracks chosen were a total joke. CAWs are terrible on this game as well. Then on top of the rest of it, this game is extremely buggy and the graphics just look bad to begin with. They literally made John Cena look like a caveman. I literally don't have a single positive thing to say about this game. Went out on a limb and bought this on a discount, and I'm still thoroughly disappointed. As someone who's been a diehard WWE fan my entire life, I seriously recommend that you NOT get this game. It is simply, terrible. 2/10

reviewText:
Please, Don't buy this at home.

If you have a controller then you may have a slightly better experience but even though this game sucks.

To begin with the Reversal system sucks you have to have a pinpoint precision to successfully reverse a opponent move, even when you anticipate and clearly see your opponent making a move its only when 2k decides now is the time to press you press or else take one.

The Grapple moves have turned into some stupid Chain Grind Move something and you have to keep figuring out the keys.

And finally when you start getting some punches to your opponent the AI steps up the game reversing everything you throw at him.

So when 2k says WWE 2K15 ushers in a new era of WWE video games! WWE 2K15 brings the hardest hitting and most fluid WWE gameplay to date" - Yeah its hard hitting but not at all fluid.

If you are like me who comes from an era of WWE SmackDown! vs. Raw - 2005 on PS2 this game is a major downer.

All in all this Game is for Rage Quit"

reviewText:
Not impressed.

First they wait to unlock the game until 6:oo pm GMT. Why not midnight? What's the difference?

Prior to this game being released on PS4 and Xbox One 2K Sports was very tight lipped about details. On release it showed why...a small roster and piddling upgrades. So why do I bring this up?

Frankly 2K games is starting to wear out my patience. The PC release of this game is unoptimized and slow. They also pulled a bit of a bait and switch by being very unclear about DLC being available to steam customers and not having Paige for not good reason.

I have a GTX 970, an i7 4790K and 8 gigs of ram. this game is choppy and slow even with that kind of hardware. Apparently 2K Sports thinks everyone owns an IBM Sequoia because this is brutal.

Half the roster is locked and I can't be arsed to go through the game to unlock it. Some of you may be fine with jumping through unfun hoops to play the game...I am not.

You would think six months after release 2K would have this game polished with all content ready to go but obviously this was a rush job. The highlight reel is also screwed up and only shows part of the graphics and no movement.

Controls are also horrid, with the buttons you press only having the most casual relationship with what happens on screen.

Wait for a discount and a patch. Also do not support 2K Sports next year if they cannot treat their customers with some sort of respect. Vote with your wallets.

reviewText:
This game could be freaking awesome! The graphics, when jacked up all the way, look almost like you're watching wrestling on television. The controls are completely opposite from what I consider intuitive, but I'm slowly retraining myself from the N64 mechanics and it's going well thus far. The sound effects are great and there's LONG snappy wrestler intros for everyone.

That said, the game has a few areas that are kind of broken... the replay/highlight system is non-functional and the ropes don't even appear at all and there's no animation. During normal play, I got flashing disappearing ropes here and there.

And, finally, the counter/reversal system is brutally unforgiving... Literally making a potentially epic gaming experience into a controller-throwing source of anger and frustration.

I'm assuming they will patch these bugs in the coming weeks.

EDIT: They have not modified the counter/reversal system and, of course, the game is still very much opposite of fun for casuals. I have uninstalled it. $50 wasted.

reviewText:
---- UPDATE ----

After a restart the game runs smoother and no graphics glitches for the last few hours. Doesn't change how very dull most of the game modes are though.

Showcase mode is so slow and plodding and the hideous models are too off putting.

Career mode has some excellent ideas but the early parts are such a bland grind that it barely seems worth it.

Universe mode has the same problems as last year. The same matches on nearly every show makes feuds entirely uninteresting.

----- ORIGINAL -----

Embarassingly poor.

Sluggish gameplay.
Hideous character models for most of the roster.
Several glitches (ropes disappearing etc)

The worst in a line of bad games.

reviewText: WWE2K15 is a flawed game in many ways. Like previous years versions, it has questionable hit detection, repeating canned commentary (though it has improved over the years), and sometimes sloppy mechanics. Even worse, it has stripped down the user creative tools to a mere handful of what it used to be.\n\nDespite all this, the re-branded SMACKDOWN game is as fast-paced and fun as it ever was. It has added a few gimmicks that freshen's up the gameplay, and this version is the closest to a wresting simulator" the franchise has ever been. Combined with the new next-gen engine
date: the game looks better than it ever has.\n\nWhile this game wont attract non-fans of wrestling
recommended: it is definitely the game to own if you have

reviewText:
Simply put, it's finally a wrestling game on PC again. Yes it has it's flaws but this is signs of good things from 2k as this was the first title handled by 2k entirely (2k14 they took over from THQ part way).
This is the base on which the next great generation of wrestling games will be built. Yes it's rough around the edges, but it still has all the charm of the WWE and enough customisation options to make any wrestler past or present. The DLC is all being provided free while it still costs a premium on consoles and it adds tons of extra stuff.
The price is a good deal for a complete" version of the game and can be gotten cheaper on some websites already. Once this hits super sale prices it will be an easy choice for any wrestling fan.
The modding possibilities in due course will surely open up very easy ways to update and maintain the roster to match the current WWE.
If you don't own a console and have been dying for a wrestling game then this is it
date: enjoy it for what it is. If you own a console you may prefer to pick up 2k14 as the 30 years of wrestlemania mode is fantastic nostalgia. The Showcase mode in this works in a similar way but some of the choices of feuds for the DLC are questionable. One more match and Hall of Pain could easily have been substituted for such rivalries as The Rock vs Austin or McMahon vs Austin (either would have included some of the same bouts)"

reviewText: This game is a blast on PC at times.  With a fun mycareer mode and the ability to play old storylines it's refreshing and simple at times.  Other times it's so mind numbingly aggravating that you want to piledrive your tower just to never see the gaem again.  The AI seems to be randomly hard or easy, sometimes in between.  Most aggravating is the reversal system.  While it's much easier on PC then on console, it's still easy to miss a reversal by a fraction of a second, or for the computer to reverse everything from a lariat to the Pedigree, even though two seconds ago they were on the ground for a good 10-20 seconds.  Another complaint is the stamina.  It seems to drain ridiculously fast.  if I do a punch combo, I shouldn't run out of stamina, especially a minute or two into the match.  It's not realistic at all. Honestly, you're better off getting ahold of Smackdown Vs Raw for PS2.  I recommend 2010, back when story mode had a set, interesting and funny story.  Regardless of this, It's still fun, and worth a playthrough if you find it on sale.

reviewText:
TL;DR – Awesome graphics. Fluid gameplay. Get it if you’re a fan of WWE games. MODS.

When I heard rumours about a PC release back when the game was initially first released for consoles I was very excited but did not hear anything for a long while and near enough gave up hope. Although it has been a long wait, WWE 2K15 is here!

I have only played a couple hours of the game so far and I have been very impressed! Especially the graphics! The graphics are phenomenal compared to the past WWE games. The superstar models and the arenas are great! I would suggest getting the game for yourself and check it them out. What even impressed me more was the audience, you now have a range of audience model scattered around the arena, and I have yet to find similar looking models within a match. In the background during a match, you see pretty much a loop of an audience model walking down the stairs, walking in the background, as if they’ve been outside and they’re heading back into their seats. I thought that was a great addition, it is very life like and amusing to watch!

The first thing that I did when I got the game was play a one-on-one match. The main menu and modes are very easy to navigate, there’s more of a visual representation compared to the past WWE games. I played the first match and the gameplay was very fluid. Compared in the past, this game runs at a slower pace but it’s not bad as it creates a nice flow of the match. In addition to that, the stamina system they’ve implemented works really well, you can really tell by the end of the match how worn out your character is. The movements and execution of moves gets more slugging which adds a nice realistic effect. There are still minor glitches with the physics of the game but that’s to be expected!

After a few matches, I then created my CAW. During this process I realised how limited the selection was, from hair to body art designs, etc. Although hopefully they’ll be some mods to provide more selection. I’m not entirely sure to why it was so limited, it might be because some are unlockable? I’m not sure but we’ll see. The create-an-entrance was also very limited compared to how it used to be but I still managed to create a decent looking entrance for my CAW.
I then went on ahead and used my CAW on My Career which was interesting. It’s similar to how it works on NBA 2K15 or previous NBA series. Where you fight a match, earn VC and upgrade using your earned VC. But I have yet to explore different aspects of this game mode.

Lastly, I had a mess around on the 2K Showcase mode which I enjoyed very much even only having played 4 matches. You get the usual video promo of an event/rivalry to which then you play the matches and meet the objectives provided to which then leads in-game scene cuts. After completing a match and meeting the desired objectives, you then unlock Superstars, Arenas and furthermore.

This game is definitely worth getting if you’re a fan of WWE, Wrestling or previous WWE games. You will have to get used to the flow of the gameplay but it is a good wrestling game. Although this game might be limited for now, there will soon be mods (hopefully) to expand the game. This is also 2K’s first Next-Gen WWE game therefore we can’t expect the game to be complete. We will have to wait and see with what they do to WWE 2K16.

reviewText:
well. first of all ya it's a great game... yet it has few bugs
1) in a simple match the ropes sometimes disappear
2) in the end of the fight or the highlights" the players and the reffree are down and the crowd is in a V formaition XD
3) when I try to make a superstar the entire game simply shuts down(windows forced me to close the program)

please

There's only so few games where you can have Captain Falcon and Solid Snake become Tag Team Champions, and this is one of them.

Easily one of the better wrestling games, and one of the best on PC. Graphics look incredible, with characters like John Cena, Randy Orton, Triple H, and Sting looking exactly like their real life counterparts. Animations are great and it's got hundreds and hundreds of moves fully animated and motion captured by actual wrestlers like Cesaro, Sami Zayn, and Adrian Neville.

Tight gameplay, I don't need to tell you just how fun these games are. Although missing some modes. Create an arena, story designer, and female created wrestlers are noticeably absent as well as having much fewer options for customization in entrance designer, and create a wrestler.

PC port works for the most part, although it has its problems. 60FPS in game, 30FPS in intros and other cutscenes, no way to turn down texture quality or certain other features. It does have an audience density slider and if you turn it all the way down to 0, you'll get a good recreation of TNA Impact.

All in all, i'm glad it came to PC. Wrestling games have been missing for many many years on PC, and it's finally good to see it return. The port could be better, could have a couple more modes, could have maybe used a couple more wrestlers or legends. But all in all, it's a great game that gives me high hopes for the future of wrestling sims on PC.

PS:If you've played any other WWE Game, expect to hear He's putting those educated feet to good use" another couple hundred thousand times."

reviewText:
The PC Port is not Perfect, there are few slowdowns or stutter especially when on different camera angle.
Good thing reducing the AA Level to 2 or 0 eliminates it.
There are 5.1 surround support. Keyboard can be bind but isn't perfect either. Example arrow keys can't be bind with modifier. Recommended to play with a Controller.
I have to say the graphics are a bout 10% sharper than the PS4 version due to Native 1080p. So you can actually see the details on the skin of the wrestlers much more.
So far i'd say that 2K has made the right choice by bringing this to PC. Keep doing it and the optimization will be better.

I've already bought the collector's edition on PS4 and owned all the DLCs so far. I'd say without the DLC the game is a barebone. Good thing PC gets it as well.
I recommend anyone with a proper gaming rig to get the PC version if you wish to play more wwe games on PC in the future. I simply got this just to give support to 2K for releasing this on PC.
Enjoying it so far on PC and PS4. It's not really a bad game.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I liked it, the gameplay takes some getting used to if you haven't kept up since Smackdown vs Raw- you can be winning then suddenly you can't seem to get the timing right for the counters and you lose after dominating most of the match.  There's a decent selection of gameplay types and the 2k showcase is a fun diversion if you're sort of a mark like me.  Like many have said this game is a port of the PS4 and Xbone version of the game which sacrifices some bells and whistles of the last gen version for prettier graphics.  As it is a console port, a controller is a must being as the default keyboard configuration isn't really all that smooth for things like chain grapples.  The game runs fine for me with the exception of weird graphical artifacts and broken replays (although the replays seem to be fixed, for me at least.), I'd make sure your rig matches at least the recommended system specs if you want to take a chance and pick this up, being as there are many people having issues with this game.  All in all, as really the only polished, somewhat current wrestling game available on PC- I'd recommend this, however if you already have this on console- there's nothing new to see here.

I haven't played a WWE game since WWE '12. I hated it.

But I found this game to be enjoyable. The controls are almost perfect for a wrestling game and it has a good amount of wrestlers, gimmicks and moves. The menus and the loading of matches are quick.

There are a lot of match types missing and the responsiveness when you grapple someone on the ground could be improved, but any imperfections and missing features can easily be chalked up to it being on a new engine and written from scratch.

I'm just hoping they carry over all the moves, arenas, match types and outfits, etc. from this game to the next. Something THQ never had the balls to do, for some reason.

All in all, pretty good.

reviewText:
Simply put, it's finally a wrestling game on PC again. Yes it has it's flaws but this is signs of good things from 2k as this was the first title handled by 2k entirely (2k14 they took over from THQ part way).
This is the base on which the next great generation of wrestling games will be built. Yes it's rough around the edges, but it still has all the charm of the WWE and enough customisation options to make any wrestler past or present. The DLC is all being provided free while it still costs a premium on consoles and it adds tons of extra stuff.
The price is a good deal for a complete" version of the game and can be gotten cheaper on some websites already. Once this hits super sale prices it will be an easy choice for any wrestling fan.
The modding possibilities in due course will surely open up very easy ways to update and maintain the roster to match the current WWE.
If you don't own a console and have been dying for a wrestling game then this is it
date: enjoy it for what it is. If you own a console you may prefer to pick up 2k14 as the 30 years of wrestlemania mode is fantastic nostalgia. The Showcase mode in this works in a similar way but some of the choices of feuds for the DLC are questionable. One more match and Hall of Pain could easily have been substituted for such rivalries as The Rock vs Austin or McMahon vs Austin (either would have included some of the same bouts)"

reviewText:
Most of the reviews for this game are about the glitches. To me, the glitches are half the game. They're ♥♥♥♥ing halarious. For instence, in Nerd³'s video, he was playing a six-man ladder match. Dolph Zigler and Triple H were on the ladder. Nerd³ -playing as Dean Ambrose - pushed over the ladder. Suddenly, for absolutely no reason what so ever, Triple H started orbiting the ring at 17 million mph, causing the camera to vibrate and making the video vertually impossible to watch until it stopped. How could you say that that is bad? (unless you threw up or something)

Now let's talk about the second half - the gameplay. Whilst a lot of the community - including me - miss the arcade-like style from the older games, I do really like the realistic gameplay that 2K introduced into this game. Nothing is more satasfying than Lionsault-ing somebody in 2K15. You really didn't get that in the older games. Even the running finishers feel very nice. The Brouge Kick has never felt so good to do when you just run at somebody and destroy their face with your Irish boot.

Unfortunately, there are downsides - a lot of them. A lot of game modes are missing like backstage fights, handicap matches, 1v1 ladder matches and so on. They added a load of pointless ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ like the King Of The Ring tounaments, which are very novel and useless. They have No Holds Bared and Extreme Rules which have no differences at all. A lot of of creation options are missing. Hairs are very dissapointing. (I don't know how many times I have seen CAWs with the same longish hair with the streak in it) Clothing is meh. Tattoos and such are dissapointing. Create a finisher is missing, along with create an arena, create a title/ championship and many more. As far as I can tell, there are no custom storylines, either.

But with all that said, it's not a bad game. There are a lot of characters and MyCareer is something to do for a bit. In what other game could you make a silly Italian man with a sock puppet fight an Iraqi General. (no, I'm not ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ you. You can do that)

reviewText: 5/10 because i love the game half the time. The graphics and animation are great but it is way too hard to control! The game seems based off reversals which are very hard to pull off. You will either hit the button too soon or too late and want to throw the controller across the room. Even kicking out of a pin is way too difficult!

reviewText: Game has some neat concepts in trying to alter the way most button mashing wrestling games work. But again suffers from the same fate as other games when it comes to A.I. , balance and gameplay. The game reverses whatever it wants and if you turn reversals down to get a better gaming experience. Then the game will ignore your button presses when it wants the computer to win.  So instead of the challenge being a computer opponent that wrestlers better, its just a game that doesnt allow you to do your moves, while giving the computer all the opportunity to do thiers, so you lose based on the computers desires instead of your effort or ability. This makes the game and gameplay cheap and frustrating instead of being a challenge or fun. Concept of gameplay and how that is handled needs to be reviewed.
